・21 世紀後半の世界の展望を描くことができる政治家はほとんどいない.　There are hardly any politicians capable of coming up with a vision for the world in the second half of the twenty-first century.

・着替えを手伝う　help sb change his clothes

てってい２【徹底】 [ローマ字](tettei)
1 〔一貫すること〕 thoroughness; completeness.
〜する be consistent.
►徹底して　＝徹底的に (⇒てっていてき)
・彼の再選には徹底して反対するつもりだ.　I intend to oppose his reelection ┏from first to last [unequivocally].
・彼は徹底してジーパンだね.　He's never without his jeans.
・彼女は徹底して肉や魚を食べない.　She invariably avoids eating meat or fish.
・徹底した　complete; thorough(going); exhaustive; all-out; downright
・徹底した議論　an exhaustive argument
・徹底したばか　a downright [an egregious] fool
・徹底した共産主義者　a dyed-in-the-wool communist
・あいつの徹底した頑固さは親譲りだ.　His incorrigible obstinacy was inherited from his parents.
・彼の徹底した仕事ぶりはさすが職人である.　His meticulous work was that of the true craftsman.
・あの人はやることが徹底している.　He does nothing by halves. ｜ He is thorough in everything he does.
・彼の倹約は実に徹底している.　His thrift is thoroughgoing.
►厨房の衛生管理の徹底を心がける　strive to maintain unqualified standards of kitchen hygiene.
2 〔すみずみまで行き渡ること〕 exhaustiveness; thoroughness.
〜する be thorough; be complete; be exhaustive.
►年功序列が徹底している社会　a society in which the seniority system is pervasive
・新しい方針を全社員に徹底させる　promulgate a new policy to all employees
・ごみは持ち帰るという方式を登山者たちに徹底させる　drum into mountain climbers the practice of taking their trash back with them
・憲法の精神を国民に徹底させる　make the spirit of the Constitution fully known to the people
・この考えを全公務員の心に徹底させなければならない.　This concept must be imprinted on the minds of all government employees.
・司令官の命令が全軍に徹底していなかった.　The commanding officer's order was not enforced among all the troops.
・チャリティー公演である旨が観客に徹底していなかったので混乱を招いた.　The fact that it was a charity performance was not known to all in the audience, resulting in some confusion.
・ごみの出し方が変わったことがまだ住民に徹底していない.　Not all the residents were aware that the garbage collection procedure had changed.
►虚礼廃止の徹底を図る　plan to eliminate meaningless formalities root and branch.
◧徹底化
►能力主義の徹底化　the total permeation of the merit system.
徹底解明
►汚職疑惑の徹底解明　a thorough elucidation of alleged corruption.
徹底究明
►機密の漏洩経路の徹底究明　a complete inquiry into the leakage of classified information.
徹底検証
►事件の原因の徹底検証　a full investigation into the cause of the incident.
徹底抗戦　do-or-die [all-out] resistance.
徹底追求　unrelenting pursuit.

・物事を徹底的にやるのが彼の主義だ.　His creed was to be thorough in all he did.
・徹底的に調査する　probe [search, sift] 《a matter》 to the bottom; make ┏a thorough [a thoroughgoing, an exhaustive] investigation
・徹底的に戦う　fight to the bitter end; fight tooth and nail
・〔選挙運動などで〕 …のために徹底的に戦う　carry on an all-out campaign for…
・徹底的に敗北する　be soundly defeated

・(ある考えを人の)頭に徹底的にたたき込む　drive into sb's mind to the hilt; (fully) drive home to sb

4 〔同時に〕 when…; as…; as soon as…; the moment that….
►食事が終わるとみんなそれぞれの部屋に引き上げて行った.　Dinner over [As soon as dinner was over], we all went off to our own rooms.
・いざ自分の番となると足がすくんで動けなくなった.　When my turn came, my legs refused to move.
5 〔…すれば〕 if…; when….
►それ以上太ると服が着られなくなってしまうよ.　If you get any fatter your clothes won't fit you any more.
・それを見るとみんな驚くだろう.　They will all be surprised ┏to [when they] see that.
・動くと撃つぞ.　Make one move and you're dead.
6 〔…したら〕 when….
►家に帰ると手紙が来ていた.　There was a letter waiting for me when I got home.
7 〔…のときはいつも〕 whenever…; when….
►彼女は笑うとえくぼができる.　When she smiles she has dimples in her cheeks.
・この季節になると故郷のことを思い出す.　When this season comes round, I always think of my hometown.
8 〔たとえ…ても〕 even if…; even though….
►だれがそう言おうと　whoever ┏says [may say] so; no matter who ┏says [may say] so
・事実であろうとなかろうと　(no matter) whether it is true or not
・何をしようと私の勝手だ.　What I do is entirely up to me. ｜ It's my own business what I do.
9 〔発言や考えの内容を表す〕 this; that; it; that….
►…と思う　think (that…)
・…と決めてかかる　take it for granted that…
・と申しますのは…　I say this because… ｜ The reason I say this is that….
►彼女は成功するだろうと私は確信している.　I feel certain that she will succeed.
10 〔比較の対象を表す〕 《different》 from…; 《similar》 to….
►それとこれとは話が違う.　That's not the same as this. ｜ That's a different issue from this one.
・彼女の字は彼のと似ている.　Her writing is similar to his.
・日本酒とウイスキーとでは日本酒のほうが好きだ.　Between whiskey and sake, I prefer sake.
11 〔交換の対象を表す〕 with…; for….
►これ, あちらのシャツと換えてくれませんか.　Would you exchange this shirt for that one? ｜ Could I have that shirt ┏instead [in place] of this one, please?

►生きとし生けるもの　all living things; everything that ┏lives [has life].
►この問題を解くのに 10 分とかからなかった.　He didn't take [It didn't take him] even [as much as] 10 minutes to solve this problem.

とどまる【止まる・留まる】 [ローマ字](todomaru)

・彼らは去り, われわれは留まった.　They left and we stayed.
2 〔一定の範囲に収まる〕 be ┏limited [confined] to….
►止まるところを知らない物価の上昇　the endless rise in commodity prices
・止まるところを知らない勝利に次ぐ勝利　an unstoppable string of victories.

・日本選手の獲得したメダルは, わずか 2 個に止まった.　Only two medals were won by Japanese athletes.
・被害額は最小限に止まった.　Damages were kept to a minimum.
・それは単なるうわさに止まった.　It ended up being mere gossip.

・白書は何らの改善案も示さず, 現状を述べるに止まっている.　The White Paper did no more than outline the situation, without offering a plan for improvement.
・違反者は彼らだけに止まらない.　They're not the only violators.
・両首相の会談は儀礼的な顔合わせに止まった.　The meeting of the two Prime Ministers was no more than a courtesy affair.
・彼の悪事はこれのみに止まらない.　His wrongdoing doesn't end there.
・彼女の欲望[野心]は止まることがなかった.　Her ┏greed [ambition] knew no bounds.
・日本経済の不振の影響は単に日本国内に止まるものではない.　The effects of the sluggish Japanese economy are not limited to Japan alone.

・ささいなことを気にするところが父親そっくりだ.　Her concern for details is just like her father.
・彼女には女らしいところがない.　There is nothing womanly about her.
・彼は学者らしいところがある.　He has something of the scholar about him.
・あの人にはちょっとそういったところがある.　There is something of that in him.
・彼の態度にはうぬぼれた[生意気な]ところがある.　His manner ┏smacks [savors] of ┏self-conceit [insolence]. ｜ He has a savor of ┏self-conceit [insolence] in his manner.
・彼女の態度には幾分冷淡なところがあった.　There was ┏a certain [a streak of] coldness in her manner.
・彼には多少頑固なところがある.　He has a ┏streak [strain, vein] of obstinacy in him.
・彼女には保守的なところがある.　There is a conservative streak in her.
・彼女の性格にはちょっと意地悪なところがあった.　There is a vindictive aspect to her nature.
・彼のそういうところが嫌いだ.　That's what I don't like about him.
・あいつにはちょっと変なところがあるからな.　He's a little bit different, you see.
・彼の曲には明るい中にもどこか哀愁を感じさせるところがある.　Even in the liveliest passages of his music you feel a certain melancholy.
・それぞれ見るところが違う.　They each have their own point of view. ｜ They view the matter from different angles. ｜ They each look at it differently.
►いいところに目をつけたね.　You've noticed something very interesting.
►…するところまでいく　go to the ┏extent [length] of doing
・その病気の研究はだいぶ進んできたが, まだ薬で治せるところまではいっていない.　Study of the disease has made great advances, but it hasn't reached the point where there is a medicine to cure it.
・あと 3 ページというところまでこぎつけた.　I've come to within three pages of the end.
・細かいところまではここでご説明できませんが.　The fine points I'm not able to explain here.
・やれるところまでやってみよう.　Let's do what we can.
►ここから先は専門家の研究を要するところだ.　From this point on we require the research of a specialist.
・これが彼の彼たるところだ.　This is a distinctive feature of his. ｜ This is where he is different.
・まあそんなところだね.　Well, that's about it.
・そこが困るところなんだよ.　That's where the problem is.
4 〔部分〕 a part; 〔一節〕 a passage.
►(小説などの)面白いところ　an interesting passage.
►大事だと思うところに線を引く　underline passages one thinks are important.
►ここのところはいろいろの意味に取れる.　This passage may be read (in) several ways.
・これからがいちばん難しいところだ.　Now we have come to the most difficult part.

・聞くところによれば　from what I hear.

・彼女が支持するところの見解　a view that she supports.
►来ないところを見ると何か急用でもできたらしい.　Seeing as he hasn't come, something urgent must have come up.
・「今週中はちょっと無理ですね」「そこのところをなんとかお願いできませんか」　"I'm a little busy this week."―"Can't you do something about that?"

►それがわれわれの望むところだ.　That is what we desire.
・それは彼女の知るところではない.　That's not something that she knows about.

・本当のところはどうなんですか.　What really happened?

►私の知ってるところでは　so far as I know; to the best of my knowledge; from what I know
・見たところでは　as far as appearance goes

・私の知ってるところでは彼に客はなかった.　He had no visitor that I know of.

・でまかせもいいところだ.　What nonsense!

・目下のところ　at present; at the moment; for the present
・…するところだ　be going to do; be (just) about to do; be on the point of doing

►危いところで　at the last moment; at a critical moment
・すんでのところで　⇒すんでのところで
・皆そろったところで乾杯といこう.　Now that everyone's here, let's have the toast.
►ちょうどその話をしていたところに彼がやってきた.　Just as we were talking about it he came up.
・せっかく話がまとまりかけたところに新たな難問が持ち上がってきた.　Just as things were coming to a settlement a new problem cropped up.
►…するところへ　just as…; as…; when…; while…
・悪いところへ来る　come at an unfavorable ┏moment [time]; come at an ill-chosen time
・いいところへ来てくれた.　You have come ┏at the right moment [at a good time].

・職を失ったところへ持ってきて家族が病気になった.　I was laid off from work and on top of that there was a sickness in my family.

・盗むところを捕える　catch sb (in the act of) stealing sth

・二人でいるところを見られてしまった.　Somebody saw us together.
►今行くところです.　I'm on my way.
・今コンサートが終わったところです.　The concert just ended.

8 〔場所柄〕 a case; an occasion.

►ところをわきまえる　be aware of the circumstances
・ところをわきまえない　be unaware of the circumstances; misunderstand the situation.

►もう少しで溺れるところだった.　I came near being drowned. ｜ I was nearly drowned.
・もう少しでひき殺されるところだった.　I was nearly run over and killed.

・〔先生が学生に〕 A をあげてもいいところだけど, 君は欠席が多いからね.　You deserve an A, but you missed so many classes.

►やってみたところ, 案外簡単だった.　When I tried doing it, I found it unexpectedly easy.
・係に問い合わせたところそういう事実はないとのことだった.　When I asked the person in charge I learned that it wasn't true at all.

所構わず　indiscriminately; no matter where 《he is》.

・ところかまわず目障りな看板を立てるのはやめてほしい.　I wish they'd stop putting up ugly signs anywhere and everywhere.

►得になる, 得である　be [prove] profitable [beneficial] 《to one》; yield ┏a profit [profits]; be in one's interest; be [prove] to one's ┏advantage [profit]; bring profit 《to one》; do sb good.
►何の得にもならない　completely ┏unprofitable [profitless] 《undertaking》
・害になっても得にはならない.　Harm may come of it, but not good.
・そんな事をしても得にはならない.　You are ┏acting against [not acting in] your best interests. ｜ That would not bring you any benefit at all.
・どっちへころんでもわれわれの得になる.　In either case, we'll come out in front. ｜ We stand to gain whichever way it goes.
►得をする　make [get, gain, reap] a profit 《from…, by doing》; profit; gain; benefit 《from…》; gain an advantage 《from…, by doing》; do ┏well [nicely] 《out of a war》 [＝とくする１]
・取引で得をする　make a profit out of [profit from] a transaction; make a ┏good [profitable] deal
・得をするばかりで損はない　have everything to gain and nothing to lose
・結局一部の者だけが得をすることになるのだ.　In the end only a small group of people will profit from it. ｜ It will end up working to the advantage of just a few people.

〜な advantageous; 〔都合のよい〕 favorable; lucky.

・得な立場にある　be in ┏an advantageous [a favorable] position; be ┏well [advantageously] placed; be at [have] an advantage.
►得になる, 得である　turn out [be, prove] to one's advantage; be valuable; 《文》 be ┏advantageous [of advantage] 《to…》
・知っておくと得になる情報　valuable [useful] information.

・踏切の手前で止まる　come to a stop before a railroad crossing.
►この電車は各駅に止まる.　This train stops at every station.
・この電車は岡山には止まらない.　This train doesn't stop at Okayama.
・この「のぞみ」は東京から名古屋までどこにも止まらない.　This "Nozomi" doesn't make any stops between Tokyo and Nagoya.
・車は私の目の前で止まった.　The car stopped right in front of me.
・電車は 30 分間横浜駅に止まっていた.　The train waited at Yokohama Station for thirty minutes.
・この車は先月からここに止まったままだ.　This vehicle has been parked here since last month.
・止まれ.　⇒とまれ１.
2 〔稼働が停止する〕 stop; 〔途絶える〕 stop; come to a halt.
►モーターが止まる　a motor stops
・手の動きが止まる　one's hands stop 《working, moving》
・水の流れが止まる　the flow of water stops
・連勝が止まる　a string of victories ┏comes to a halt [is broken].
►〔タイマーで〕 洗濯機が止まった.　The washing machine has stopped.
・(水道の)水が止まらない.　The water won't stop flowing.
・行進が止まった.　The parade stopped.
・恐怖で息が止まりそうだった.　I almost stopped breathing. I was so terror-stricken.
3 〔働かなくなる〕 stop (working); stop (being supplied); be stopped.
►工事のために正午から水道とガスが止まる.　Because of construction work, the water and gas will be cut off from noon.
・大雪で朝から電車が止まっている.　The trains have been stopped since morning because of the heavy snowfall.
・あっ, 時計が止まっている.　Hey, my watch has stopped!
・冬の間噴水は止まっている.　During the winter the fountain is turned off.
4 〔止む〕 stop; cease; 〔静まる〕 subside; die down.
►痛みが止まる　the pain ┏stops [subsides]
・汗が止まる　one stops sweating
・出血が止まる　〈傷または人が主語〉 stops bleeding
・成長が止まる　growth stops; 〈人が主語〉 one stops growing
・咳が止まる　the coughing stops; 〈人が主語〉 stops coughing.
►呼吸[脈]が止まった.　The ┏breathing [pulse] has stopped.
・ようやく咳が止まった.　My cough has finally stopped.
・悲しくて涙が止まらない.　I'm so sad I can't stop crying.
・優勝に向けてチームの勢いは止まらない.　The team's march to the championship is unstoppable.
・商売繁盛で笑いが止まらない.　Her business is thriving so much she can't stop grinning.
・業績の伸びが止まった.　Business growth has stopped.
・本の売れ行きが止まった.　Demand for the book has stopped.
・株の下落が止まらない.　The fall in share prices won't stop. ｜ Share prices won't stop falling.

とめる１【止める・停める】 [ローマ字](tomeru)
1 〔稼働を停止する〕 stop; (電源を切る) turn off; cut off; 〔途絶えさせる〕 stop; put an end to sth.
►供給を止める　stop supplying sth; stop ┏(a) supply [supplies] 《of…》
・水を止める　〔水道を〕 turn off the water; 〔水流を〕 stop [stem, dam] a ┏stream [flow]
・ガスの元栓を止める　turn off the gas at the main
・ラジオを止める　turn off a radio
・〔乗馬で〕 馬を止める　pull up [rein in] a horse; bring one's horse to a stop
・仕事の手を止める　stop working; take a break from one's work.
►〔料金不払いで〕 電気もガスも止められた.　Both our electricity and our gas were cut off.
・彼のホームランがチームの連敗を止めた.　His home run brought the team's losing streak to an end.
・改革の流れを止めてはならない.　We mustn't check the ┏course [flow] of reform.
2 〔通過を阻止する〕 block; stop; 〔停車させる〕 stop; 〔停船させる〕 prevent 《a ship》 from sailing.
►打球を止める　stop a batted ball
・強烈なアタックを止める　【バレーボール】 block a fierce attack
・車を止める　〔運転手が〕 bring a car to a ┏halt [stop]; 〔運転手に指示して〕 stop a car 《from proceeding further》
・通行[交通]を止める　stop passage; stop [hold up] traffic
・〔手をあげて〕 タクシーを止める　stop [wave down, *flag (down)] a cab
・〔一時的に〕 船を止める　heave a ship to.
►車は検問で止められた.　The vehicle was stopped for inspection.
・〔運転手に〕 あの劇場の前で止めてください.　Stop in front of that theater over there, please.
・この話は君のところで止めておいてくれ.　Please don't let what we've talked about go any further than you.
3 〔やめさせる〕 stop; prevent; stop sb from doing; 〔禁止する〕 forbid; prohibit sb from doing.
►けんかを止める　stop a quarrel; put ┏an end [a stop] to a quarrel; 〔仲裁する〕 get [intervene] between two people quarreling
・止めるのも聞かずに　in ┏defiance [spite] of sb's ┏prohibition [efforts to stop sth].
►彼が出かけるのを止めてくれ.　Don't let him ┏go out [leave the house].
・いくら止めても彼女は聞かなかった.　I tried to stop her but she wouldn't listen.
・それは誰にも止められないだろう.　I don't suppose that can be ┏prevented [stopped] by anyone.
・どうしてもと言うのなら私は止めない.　If you insist on doing it, I won't try to stop you.
・入浴は医者に止められている.　My doctor has ┏prohibited me from taking [ordered me not to take] hot baths.
4 〔静める〕 stop; 〔制御する・進行を抑える〕 stop.
►痛みを止める　stop pain
・咳を止める　stop a cough
・出血を止める　stop [arrest, stem] bleeding [a flow of blood]
・母乳を止める　stop breastfeeding 《a baby》
・成長を止める　stop [arrest, stunt] the growth 《of…》
・インフレを止める　stop [check, stem] inflation
・(写真の現像で)色を止める　fix the colors.
►敵の勢いを止めることができなかった.　We were unable to ┏check [stop] the enemy force's momentum.
・涙を止めようと思ったがだめだった.　I tried to ┏stop [hold back] the tears, but I couldn't.

とらわれる【捕われる・囚われる】 [ローマ字](torawareru)
1 〔捕えられる〕 be ┏caught [seized, taken, captured]; be ┏arrested [apprehended].
►詐欺をして捕われる　be arrested for fraud.
2 〔こだわる〕 be a slave to [stick to, adhere to] 《a habit, a tradition》; be a stickler for 《formalities》; be shackled by 《habit》; be swayed by 《passion》.
►外見にとらわれる　be swayed by appearances
・先入観にとらわれた考え　a view that adheres to preconceived ┏notions [ideas]
・因習にとらわれる　be a slave to ┏custom [convention]
・とらわれない　unprejudiced; freewheeling
・伝統にとらわれない　be ┏free from [unhampered by] tradition(s).
►彼はあまりにも目先のことにとらわれすぎている.　He is too much swayed by the needs of the moment.
・彼女は初めからこの考えにとらわれていた.　Right from the start she was obsessed with this idea.
・既成概念にとらわれて斬新なアイディアが出てこない.　We're all shackled by stereotypical thinking, and so we can't come up with fresh ideas.
・とらわれない目で見れば, 彼女のほうがこのポストにふさわしいことは明らかであろう.　If one looks at it with an unbiased mind, it would seem clear that she is a more appropriate choice for this position.
3 〔激しい感情などに支配されて, のがれられない〕 be seized 《with…》; gripped 《by…》.
►悲しみにとらわれる　be gripped by ┏sadness [sorrow, grief]
・恐怖にとらわれる　be seized with panic; be gripped by fear; be struck with terror.
►彼は恐怖にとらわれている.　He is ┏gripped by fear [seized by terror, seized with panic, fallen prey to fear].
・二度とここへは帰って来れないのではないか, 彼女はそんな思いにとらわれていた.　She'd never again be able to return to this place―she was gripped by the thought.

とる１【取る】 [ローマ字](toru)
1 〔手に持つ〕 take in one's hand; pick up; grab (a) hold of…; 〔選ぶ〕 take; choose.
►受話器を取る　pick up the receiver (of a phone)
・電話を取る　answer a phone
・子供の手を取る　take the hand of a child in one's hand; take a child by the hand
・胸ぐらを取る　seize sb by the ┏lapel(s) [collar]
・前みつを取る　【相撲】 grab onto the front of the other wrestler's belt
・手前にあるほうを取る　choose ┏the one [a thing] that is closer to oneself
・取りに行く　go for sth; go to ┏get [fetch] sth
・品物を取りに来る　come [call] for [to pick up] sth
・取りに来るまで置いておく　leave sth till called for
・取りにやる　send for…; send sb ┏for [after] sth; dispatch sb for…
・取ってくる　go and ┏get [fetch] sth
・取って食う　⇒とってくう.
►ご自由にお取りください.　〔掲示〕 Please take one.
・彼はマイクを取って演説を始めた.　He took the microphone in one hand and began his speech.
・サラダをお取りしましょうか.　Would you like me to dish up some salad for you?
・〔食卓で〕 その塩を取ってください.　Pass me the salt, please.
・そのペンを取ってください.　Could you please pass me that pen?
・あの棚の上の本を取ってください.　Will you reach me that book on the shelf?
・おつりは取っておいてください.　Keep the change.
・この中から好きなのを取ってください.　Please choose whichever you like.
・仕事と家庭とどちらを取るか.　Which to choose: work, or the home?
2 〔手に入れる〕 get (a hold of…); (取得する) acquire; obtain; receive; (獲得する) acquire; secure.
►学位を取る　obtain a degree
・資格を取る　acquire a qualification
・休暇を取る　take a ┏holiday [vacation]; get ┏leave [a furlough]; get some days off
・パスポートを取る　get a passport
・許可を取る　get [receive] permission
・金メダルを取る　〔スポーツで〕 win a gold medal; 〔展覧会などで〕 receive a gold medal 《at an exhibition》
・満点を取る　get a ┏perfect score [hundred, 100]; ᐦget [score] full marks
・天下を取る　⇒てんか１ 2
・飛車を取る　【将棋】 capture a rook
・客から注文を取る　take a customer's order.
►彼は月給を取る身になった.　He got a job with a monthly salary. ｜ He's become a salaried worker.
・彼女は優秀賞を取った.　She ┏took [got] the award for excellence.
・全日本が先に点を取った.　The Japanese all-stars scored the first ┏run [point].
3 〔確保する〕 secure; reserve; ensure one has.
►順番を取る　secure one's ┏place [turn]
・席を取る　〔確保する〕 get [secure] a ┏place [seat] 《for sb》; (食堂などで) get a table; 〔予約する〕 reserve [engage, book] a seat 《in a train, for a play》 [⇒せき２ 1]
・会議室を取る　reserve a meeting room
・居間を広く取る　devote plenty of space to the living room.
►10 時発の特急の指定席が取ってある.　I ┏have [have booked] a reserved seat on the superexpress departing at ┏10:00 [ten hours].
・直行便は満席で取れなかった.　The direct flight was fully booked and I couldn't get a seat.
4 〔奪う〕 take; steal.
►どろぼうに財布を取られた.　My wallet was stolen.
・あいつが取った!　He took it away from me!
・彼が私のアイデアを取った.　He stole my idea(s).
・あの店に客を取られた.　That ┏store [shop] stole [took] customers away from us.
・命まで取ろうとは言っていないさ.　I'm not going to kill you.
・あの男に娘を取られた気分だ.　I feel as if my daughter has been stolen by that fellow.
5 〔なくす・取り除く〕 remove; get rid of; (しみなどを) take out; 〔外す〕 take off.
►壁[服]のよごれを取る　remove dirt from a wall [take a stain out of clothing]
・顔のしみ[しわ]を取る　remove facial ┏blemishes [wrinkles]
・痛みを取る　remove [get rid of] pain [aches]
・疲れを取る　get rid of tiredness
・ぞうきんでほこりを取る　wipe away dust with a damp cloth
・花壇の雑草を取る　remove weeds from [weed] a flower bed
・(手術で) 胃を半分取る　have half of one's stomach taken out
・糸くずを取る　remove ┏waste thread [bits and pieces of thread]
・(商品から)値札を取る　remove [take off] the price tag
・眼鏡を取る　take off one's eyeglasses.
►〔校正で〕 トル　delete (略: dele., d.) ▶通例 � と書く
・〔校正で〕 この a の字を取ってください.　Please delete this a.
・彼女は包帯を取って傷を見せた.　She took the bandage off and showed us the wound.
・彼は帽子を取って会釈した.　He doffed his hat to us.
・古いボタンを取って新しいのをつけた.　I took off the old buttons and put new ones on.
6 〔記録する〕 record; (書いて) take down.
►心電図を取る　record an electrocardiogram
・データを取る　record data
・メモを取る　take down notes; make a note [take notes] 《of…》
・コピーを取る　make a copy.
►控えを 2 部取っておいた.　I made two copies.
7 〔必要とする〕 take; need.
►時間を取る　take time
・幅を取る　take up ┏width [space to the sides].
►この机はずいぶん場所を取る.　This desk takes (up) an awful lot of space.
・渋滞で思いがけず時間を取られた.　Because of the heavy traffic we needed more time than we expected.
・手間を取らせて申し訳ありません.　I must apologize for taking up so much of your time.
8 〔徴収する〕 take; charge.
►税金を取る　take ┏a tax [taxes].
►手数料を千円取られた.　I was charged \1,000 handling fee.
・あの店で食事をしたらいくら取られるかわからないぞ.　If you have a meal in that shop you can't be sure how much you'll be charged.
・〔財布を渡して〕 ここから取ってくれ.　Take it from here.
・それは(料金の)取りすぎだ.　They've charged you too much.
9 〔解釈する〕 understand; interpret; grasp.
►意味を正しく取る　understand correctly
・意味を曲げて取る　distort the meaning.
►この文の意味がうまく取れない.　I don't grasp the meaning of this sentence very well.
・そういう意味に取られては困る.　I don't want you to ┏take [understand] it in that sense.
・どうか悪く取らないでください.　Please don't take it amiss.
10 〔出前させる〕 have delivered; 〔注文する〕 order.
►昼食にカツ丼を取る　have a bowl of boiled rice with deep-fried pork cutlet delivered for lunch
・〔飲食店で〕 ビールを取る　order a beer.
11 〔定期購読する〕 take [subscribe to, get] 《a magazine》; 〔定期購入する〕 buy; get.
►朝日新聞を取っている.　We take the Asahi.
・毎月文芸春秋を取っている.　We get the Bungei Shunjū every month.
・新聞は取らないことにした.　I decided not to subscribe to any newspaper.
・お米はいつも決まった店から取っている.　We always ┏buy [get] our rice at the same store.
12 〔迎え入れる〕 accept; adopt; take on.
►婿[嫁]を取る　take a ┏husband [wife].
►夫婦は養子を取った.　The couple adopted a child.
・私は弟子は取らない.　I don't ┏accept [take on] any apprentices.
13 【数】
►平方根を取る　take the square root 《of…》
・方程式の両辺の対数を取る　take ┏logarithms [《口》 logs] of both sides of the equation
・x の実数値に対して y の取る値の集合　the set of values that y must take for real values of x.
取るに足りない[足らない]　⇒とるにたりない.
取るものも取りあえず　in great haste; in a great hurry; without a moment's delay; immediately.
►取るものも取りあえず上京する　hurry up into ┏town [the big city] without a moment's delay
・その知らせを受けると, 彼は取るものも取りあえず現場に急行した.　As soon as [Directly] he heard the news, he hastened to the spot.

とる５【採る・摂る】 [ローマ字](toru)
►経験者を採る　take [hire] someone with experience
・最善の手段を採る　take the best ┏means [steps, measures]
・〔議会で〕 決を採る　take a vote
・尿を採って調べる　have a urine sample examined
・〔植物採集で〕 シダを採る　gather ferns
・窓から光を採る　let light in through the window

►当社は今年 20 人の技術者を採る.　This company will hire twenty engineers this year.
・親戚の会社に採ってもらった.　I was accepted into a company owned by one of my relatives.

・食事は規則正しく摂るようにしている.　We have our meals at regular (set) times.

-として [ローマ字](toshite)
1 〔資格・役割などを示す〕 as…; in the capacity of….
►医師として判断した.　I made a judgment as a physician.
・彼女は外交官として渡米した.　She went to the United States in the capacity of a diplomat.
・池田君は画家だが, 今回は詩人として表彰された.　Ikeda is an artist, but on this occasion he received an award as a poet.
・彼女とは隣人としてつきあっている.　My relationship with her is as a neighbor.
・これを記念品として君にあげよう.　Let me give you this as a memento.
・この犬は警察犬として優秀だ.　As a police dog, this dog is excellent.
・その選手にはプロとしての自覚が足りない.　That player doesn't have the self-awareness of a professional.
・その事件は記事としておもしろい.　The incident makes an interesting article.
・それは解決の手段として適当ではない.　As a method of resolving things it is inappropriate.
・私は父親としては落第だ.　As a father I am a failure.
・彼は家族を労働力としてしかみていない.　He sees his family only as a source of labor.
・私は母親として幸福だった.　As a mother I was very happy.
・紛争の調停者としては彼に匹敵する者はない.　As a mediator (of disputes) there is no one who can compare with him.
・日本国民は, 武力の行使は, 国際紛争を解決する手段としては, 永久にこれを放棄する.　The Japanese people forever renounce the use of force as a means of settling international disputes.
2 〔(打ち消しを伴って) 全面否定を表す〕
►だれ一人として彼に賛成するものはなかった.　Not a single person agreed with him.
3 ⇒-としては.

-としては [ローマ字](-toshiteha)
1 〔本来の特性に反して〕 for…; considering….
►東京の夏としては涼しい日だった.　For a summer day in Tokyo it was cool.
・今時の若者としては礼儀正しい.　As young people go these days, she has good manners.
・彼は男としては声が高い.　His voice is high for a man.
・彼女は日本人としては英語が上手だ.　For a Japanese person, her English is excellent.
2 〔特定の人・組織を示す〕 as for….
►今回のことは私としては[といたしましては]容認できません.　For my part I cannot give my approval to the matter at hand.
・当社としては[といたしましては]全力をあげて調査する所存です.　It is the intention of the Company to devote its energies to the survey.
・「高田君が首席だそうだ」「いつも首席の佐々木さんとしてはおもしろくないだろう」　"I'm told Takada came out at the head of the class."―"The perennial holder of the top spot, Sasaki, is unlikely to be pleased."

-としても [ローマ字](-toshitemo)
even if…; even though…; though…; although…; granting [supposing] that….
►それが事実としても　granting [supposing] it to be true [that it is true]; granted it is true
・たとえ君のほうが正しいとしても　even if you are in the right.
►彼はその金を, 全部ではないとしても半分以上使ってしまった.　He has spent more than half the money, if not all of it.
・それが事実だとしても今さらどうしようもない.　Even if that should be the case, there's nothing you can do at this point.
・スーツが 1 週間でできるとしてももう入社式には間に合わない.　Even if my suit is finished in a week, it won't be in time for the ceremony welcoming new employees.
・誤植があるとしてもごくわずかだ.　There are very few misprints, if any.
・君の言うとおりだとしてもやはりこの案には賛成できない.　Granted you are right, I still cannot agree to this plan.

つごう【都合】 [ローマ字](tsugō)
1 〔諸事のかねあい〕 one's convenience; 〔さしさわり〕 a reason; a 《prior》 commitment.
►時間の都合もありますので　because of the time.
►…できない都合がある　be unable to do [cannot do] for some reason
・その日は都合が悪い.　That's a bad day for me. ｜ I have something else planned for that day.
・都合が悪くて出席できない.　I will be unable to attend because of other commitments.
・月曜なら都合がよい.　Monday would be a good day for me.
・そうしてくれると大変都合がよい.　I would appreciate it very much if you could do that for me.
・明日晴れると都合がよいのだが.　It would be nice if the weather clears up tomorrow.
・ご都合がよければ今からうかがいますが.　If it's all right with you, I'd like to come over now.
・私にも都合がある.　I'm not always available. ｜ I have my own commitments.
・都合があって会議に行けなかった.　I had other business and couldn't make it to the meeting.
・全員の都合がなかなか合わない.　It's hard to find a time that would be good for everyone.
・どんな都合があるか知らないが遅刻は許せない.　I don't care what his reason is. He must not be late.
►何かの都合で　for some reason or other
・仕事の都合で　because of one's work
・家の都合で退職した.　He resigned for family reasons.
・飛行機を乗り継ぐ都合で到着に時間がかかる.　It will take me a while to get there because I have to change planes.
►一身上の都合により　for personal reasons
・種々の都合により　for various reasons
・その日の都合によっては君に付き合うこともできる.　Depending on what's happening that day, I may be able to go with you.
►都合のいいときに　when convenient (with one)
・都合のよいほうを選ぶ　choose whichever is convenient for one
・ご都合のよいように計らいます.　I'll arrange things to your convenience.
►相手の都合を聞く　ask whether sth is convenient for sb; ask whether sb is available.
►明日のご都合はいかがですか.　How would tomorrow be for you?
・こちらの都合ばかり言ってすみません.　I'm sorry to talk about only what's convenient for me.
・当日の都合次第では参加できます.　I may be able to participate depending on my situation that day.
・こっちの都合も考えてほしい.　I wish you would think about my position, too.
・何か来られない都合でもあるんですか.　Is there any reason why you wouldn't be able to come?
2 〔思惑〕 one's ┏wish [desire]; 〔見通し〕 one's expectations; 〔調子〕 one's situation; one's condition.
►都合どおりに　as desired; as one ┏wants [wishes].
►文庫本は持ち歩くのに都合がよい.　Paperbacks [*Pocketbooks] are handy for carrying around.
・この金があると都合がいい.　This money will ┏come in handy [be convenient] for me.
・集合場所が東京駅だと都合がよいのだが.　Tokyo Station would be a convenient meeting place for me.
・紹介状がいただけると都合がよいのですが.　I'd appreciate it if you could give me a letter of introduction.
・彼女は約束をすぐ忘れてしまうから都合が悪い.　She's ┏hard [《口》 a real pain] to deal with because she never remembers her promises.
►私 1 人の都合で決めることはできない.　I can't make a decision based only on my own wishes.
・自分たちだけの都合で予定を変えないでくれ.　Don't change the plan just to fit your whims.
►ご都合にかなう[都合のよい]ように　as you wish
・君の都合にばかりは合わせられない.　We can't do everything the way you want.
►自分に都合のよい考え方をする　indulge in wishful thinking
・都合のよいことだけは覚えている　remember only what one wants to; have a convenient memory
・ずいぶん都合のいい解釈だな.　That's a very convenient way to ┏look at [interpret] it, I must say.
・犯人に都合のよい状況は作れない.　We can't create a situation that would favor the criminal.
・それは彼女には都合の悪いできごとだった.　That was an unfortunate event for her.
►彼の都合を考えると気の毒だ.　When I think about his situation, I feel sorry for him.
►自分の都合ばかり言い立てるな.　Don't keep making such one-sided demands.
3 〔なりゆき〕 how 《sth happened》; the background 《of an incident》; 〔折〕 a chance; an opportunity; a 《good》 time 《for…》.
►今なら退出するのに都合がよい.　Now would be a good time to leave.
►どういう都合でそういうことになったのか.　How did that happen?
►そう都合よくはいかない.　Things don't always go as you might want.
・都合よくタクシーが拾えた.　I caught a taxi right away.
・ちょうど都合よく彼が現れた.　He showed up at just the right time.
4 〔やりくり〕 an arrangement.
〜する arrange; manage.
►時間を都合する　make [find] (the) time 《to do, for…》
・金を都合する　get (the) money together 《to do, for…》
・来週までに 700 万円都合しなければならない.　I have to get \7 million together by next week.
・住宅を都合する　find [arrange] housing 《for…》
・一晩だけ部屋を都合してもらえませんか.　Could you get a room for me for just one night?
・なんとか都合しましょう.　I'll do what I can.
►都合がつく　can [be able to] arrange…
・いつなら(時間の)都合がつきますか.　What would be a good time for you?
・ご都合がつきましたら　if you could arrange it; 〔出席依頼など〕 if you aren't busy
・日程の都合がついたらシカゴにも立ち寄りたい.　I'd also like to swing by Chicago if I can fit it into my schedule.
・返済期限までにどうにか(金の)都合がついた.　I managed to get the money together before the repayment deadline.
・トラックの都合がつかなかった.　I couldn't arrange a truck.
►都合をつける　⇒〜がつく
・30 分だけ, なんとか都合をつけてくれませんか.　Could you spare me just 30 minutes?
5 〔全部で〕 in total; in all; all together; all told. [⇒ごうけい]
►都合…となる　total…; add up to…
・出費は都合10 万円となった.　The expenses totaled \100,000.
►参加者は都合12 人だ.　There are 12 participants in all.
◧御都合主義　⇒ごつごうしゅぎ.

2 〔回線などがつながる〕 get connected 《with…》; 〔応答が得られる〕 get through 《to sb》; 【電】 〔(電流が) 流れる〕 flow; 〔(電流を) 流す〕 pass 《a current》.

・青木さんに電話をかけたが(不在で)通じなかった.　I could not get Mr. Aoki on the phone. ｜ I couldn't get through to Mr. Aoki.
・〔電話で〕 10 回目でようやく通じた.　〔呼び出し音が〕 I finally got through on the tenth ring. ｜ 〔かけ直して〕 The tenth time I called, I finally got through.
・この針金には電流が通じている.　This is a live wire.
・この村にはまだ電気が通じていない.　Electricity isn't yet available in this village.
3 〔相手に伝わる〕 be understood; be comprehended; (外国語や方言が) be spoken.
►自分の意思を相手に通じさせる　make oneself understood; get across the idea [meaning]
・そこでは日本語が通じる.　Japanese is spoken there.
・気持ちが通じる　one's feelings are understood
・目と目で通じる　communicate with one's eyes.
►私の言いたいことが通じただろうか.　Was I able to get across what I wanted to say?
・病人どうしだからよく話が通じる.　We are both ill so are able to understand one another quite well.
・なぞをかけたが彼に通じなかった.　He didn't pick up on my hint.
・君は冗談の通じないやつだ.　You don't catch on to humor.
・一念が天に通じた.　My long-cherished hope has at last been realized.
・この文章は意味が通じない.　The meaning of this passage isn't clear. ｜ This passage doesn't make sense.
・彼女には日本語が通じない.　She doesn't understand Japanese.
・ハワイには日本語の通じる店が多い.　Japanese is spoken in many of the stores in Hawaii.
・私の英語が彼には通じなかった.　He didn't understand what I said in English.
・この国では何語が通じるんですか.　What language ┏do they speak [is spoken] in this country?
4 〔通用する〕 pass 《for…》; hold ┏true [water]; be good; work; be honored.
►世界に通じる技術力　technological skill of world-class.
►そのようなわがままはここでは通じない.　Such self-centeredness will not be tolerated here.
・彼に理屈は通じない.　He does not listen to reason.
・彼らの日本語は永田町でしか通じない.　The Japanese they speak is intelligible only in Nagata-chō.
・ユゴーの発想は現代にも通じるところがある.　Some elements of Hugo's thought still hold today.
5 〔精通する〕 be ┏well [deeply] versed 《in…》; be posted 《in…》; be (well) up 《in…》; be proficient 《in…》; be at home 《in [on]…》; be a master 《of…》; be [become] familiar [well acquainted] 《with…》; be well informed 《about…》; be conversant 《with…》.
►その組織の内情に通じている　have inside information regarding that organization
・フランス史に通じている　have a ┏good [thorough] knowledge of French history; be conversant with French history
・時事問題に通じている　be up on current issues.
►京都で育ったからその土地柄には通じている.　Because I was raised in Kyoto, I am familiar with the locality.
・彼はデパート業界に通じている.　He is well informed on the department store industry.
・彼女は現代哲学に通じている[いない].　She is ┏well read [unversed] in modern philosophy.
6 〔ひそかに連絡する〕 communicate secretly [intrigue] 《with the enemy》; betray; be in touch with 《the other party》.
►気脈を通じる　keep [be] in touch 《with…》; be in secret communication 《with…》; have a tacit understanding 《with…》

►相手方と通じてなした虚偽の意思表示は無効とする.　【民法】 A fictitious declaration of intention made in collusion with the other party is null and void.
7 〔異性と関係する〕 become intimate 《with…》; have relations 《with…》; form a liaison 《with…》; commit ┏misconduct [adultery] 《with…》; (姦通する) intrigue 《with…》.
►情を通じる　have illicit intercourse 《with sb》.
►彼女は友人の夫と通じた.　She had an affair with her friend's husband.

the remnant; the remainder; (the) leftovers; those left unused; 〔半端物〕 odds and ends.
〜の remnant; leftover 《from…》.

つかいのこす【使い残す】 [ローマ字](tsukainokosu)
leave sth unused; leave 《money》 unspent; leave sth over after use; have sth left.
►プリペイドカードを 10 円使い残す　have \10 left on a prepaid card.

つかいっぱしり【使いっ走り】 [ローマ字](tsukaippashiri)
＝つかいばしり.

つかいさき【使い先】 [ローマ字](tsukaisaki)
〔使いに行った場所〕 the place where one is sent on an errand; 〔(金の) 使い道〕 how money is spent.
►君などは金の使い先がなくて困っているのだろう.　You don't know what to do with your money, do you?
►使い先で油を売る　loaf away one's time going on an errand.

つかいすぎ【使い過ぎ】 [ローマ字](tsukaisugi)
overuse; abuse.
►パソコンによる目の使い過ぎで頭痛がしてきた.　I got a headache from using my eyes too much at a PC.
◧使いすぎ症候群　【医】 the overuse syndrome.

つかいすぎる【使い過ぎる】 [ローマ字](tsukaisugiru)
use ┏too much [in excess, excessively]; spend too much; 〔酷使する〕 work 《one's subordinate》 too hard; overwork 《one's eyes》; overtask; overdrive.
►金を使い過ぎる　spend too much money 《on…》; spend one's money too freely
・頭を使い過ぎる　overtax [overuse] one's brains
・体を使い過ぎる　work too hard; overwork [overtax] oneself; burn the candle at both ends.
►君はどうでもいいことにも気を使い過ぎる.　You're too scrupulous about ┏trifles [inconsequential things].

つかいすて【使い捨て】 [ローマ字](tsukaisute)
►使い捨てにする　〔一度だけ使って〕 use sth only once and then throw it away; 〔使えるだけ使って〕 get all the use out of sth and then discard it.
►使い捨ての　disposable; throwaway; single-use; one-time-use; use-once, throw-away
・使い捨ての紙おむつ　a ┏disposable [throwaway] *diaper [ᐦnappy]
・使い捨ての時代　the "throwaway age"; the age of discarding things that are still useable.
◧使い捨て型ロケット　an expendable launch vehicle (略: ELV).
使い捨てかみそり　a disposable razor.
使い捨てカメラ　a single-use [disposable, throwaway] camera.
使い捨てコンタクト・レンズ　disposable contact lenses.
使い捨て注射器　a disposable syringe.
使い捨て文化　the "throwaway culture."
使い捨てライター　a ┏disposable [throwaway] (cigarette) lighter.

つかいたおす【使い倒す】 [ローマ字](tsukaitaosu)
〔(機械の)機能を徹底的に活用する〕 apply all the functions 《of a device》.
►新作ソフトを使い倒す　make full use of a new software
・携帯電話を使い倒す　use all the functions of a cellphone.

つかいて【使い手】 [ローマ字](tsukaite)
1 〔使用者〕 a user; 〔購入者〕 a consumer; 〔雇い主〕 an employer.
►あんな男ではどこにも使い手があるまい.　No one will employ such a man. ｜ He will not find employment anywhere.
►使い手の声を反映する　reflect the opinions of consumers.
2 〔達人〕 a 《fencing》 master.
►やりの使い手　an experienced [a master] spearman.
►彼はなかなかの剣の使い手だ.　He is a master swordsman.

つかいつけ【使いつけ】 [ローマ字](tsukaitsuke)
〜の familiar; favorite.
►使いつけの化粧品　one's favorite cosmetics.

つかいつける【使いつける】 [ローマ字](tsukaitsukeru)
►使いつけない枕　a pillow one is not used to.
►カメラは使いつけたもののほうがいい.　It is best to use a camera you are familiar with.

つかいつくす【使い尽くす】 [ローマ字](tsukaitsukusu)
＝つかいはたす.

つかいわけ【使い分け】 [ローマ字](tsukaiwake)
proper [appropriate] use.
►前置詞[漢字]の使い分け　the proper use of ┏prepositions [kanji]
・select と choice の使い分け　the proper use of the words [distinguishing between] "select" and "choice."
►彼女は敬語の使い分けができない.　She is unable to use honorific expressions properly.
►使い分けを心得ている　know how to use sth properly
・相手によって態度の使い分けをする　adapt one's attitude according to who the other person is; suit one's manner to the people one is with.

つかいわける【使い分ける】 [ローマ字](tsukaiwakeru)
use different…for different purposes.
►道具を使い分ける　use different tools for different tasks
・各種の包丁を使い分ける　use an appropriate kitchen knife for each purpose
・聴衆に応じて言葉を使い分ける　vary one's language to suit the audience
・声色(こわいろ)を使い分ける　mimic different tones of voice
・〔海外旅行などで〕 国ごとに言葉を使い分ける　use a different language in each country.
►彼は内の顔と外の顔を使い分けている.　He has one face for those close to him and another face for outsiders.
・彼女は相手によって 3 か国語を使い分ける.　She switches between three languages depending on the other person.

つかいやすい【使い易い】 [ローマ字](tsukaiyasui)
easy [convenient] to use; user-friendly.
使いやすさ　ease of use; user-friendliness.
►このパソコンは使いやすさという点でまだ問題がある.　This PC still has a few problems when it comes to ┏user-friendliness [ease of use].

つかいよう【使い様】 [ローマ字](tsukaiyō)
〔どのように使っているか〕 ＝つかいかた.
►同じ言葉でも使いようが悪いと誤解される.　The same word, if it is used in the wrong way, can lead to misunderstanding.
►100 円でも使いようで1,000 円になる.　\100 well spent is worth \1,000.
►はさみは使いようで切れる.　Scissors work well ┏if they are [when] rightly used.
・ばかとはさみは使いよう(で切れる).　⇒ばか
・金は使いようだ.　Whether money goes a long way or not depends on how it is spent.
・あの程度の男でも使いようだ.　Even a man like that can be of some use.

つうかく１【通格】 [ローマ字](tsūkaku)
【文法】 the common case.

つうかく２【痛覚】 [ローマ字](tsūkaku)
a ┏sense [sensation] of pain; sensitiveness to pain; algesthesia(s).
►無痛覚の　analgesic.
◧痛覚閾値(いきち)　【生理】 the pain threshold.
痛覚異常　【医】 paralgesia.
痛覚過敏(症)　【医】 hyperalgesia.
痛覚計　【医】 an algometer; an algesimeter.
痛覚嗜好症　【医】 algophilia.
痛覚脱失[消失]　【医】 〔痛覚の麻痺〕 analgesia.
痛覚中枢　【生理】 the pain center.
痛覚鈍麻[低下]　【医】 hypalgesia.
痛覚発生　【生理】 algogenesis; algogenesia.

つかまえどころ【掴まえ所】 [ローマ字](tsukamaedokoro)
＝つかみどころ.

つかまえる【捕まえる・掴まえる・捉まえる】 [ローマ字](tsukamaeru)
1 〔拘束する・捕獲する〕 catch; capture; seize; 〔自分のものにする〕 get; obtain; 〔逮捕する〕 arrest; catch; collar; nab; *《口》 corral; ᐦ《口》 nick.
►カブトムシ[逃げた鳥]をつかまえる　catch ┏a beetle [an escaped bird]
・つかまえられたサル　a captured monkey
・犯人をつかまえる　capture [catch, nab] a criminal.
►(鬼ごっこで)つかまえた!　I got you! ｜ 《口》 Gotcha!
・ライオンは一度つかまえた獲物は放さない.　Once a lion has caught its prey it never lets it go.
・彼女は資産家の息子を(結婚相手に)つかまえたそうだ.　《口》 I hear that she's ┏hooked [nabbed] a rich man's son.
・彼はたった 1 度のチャンスをつかまえて成功した.　He grabbed at a once-in-a-lifetime chance and succeeded.
・あの空き巣ねらいを今度こそつかまえてやる.　We're going to nab that burglar now.
・泥棒だ! その泥棒をつかまえろ.　〔追いかけながら〕 Stop, thief! Catch that thief!
・その女はすりです. だれかつかまえて!　That woman's a pickpocket. Somebody grab her!
2 〔呼び止める〕 catch; grab; 〔引き留める〕 stop.
►通りでタクシーをつかまえる　catch [grab, hail] a taxi on the street.
►見知らぬ人をつかまえて道を聞いた.　I stopped a stranger and asked for directions.
・ウエートレスをつかまえて追加の注文をした.　I hailed a waitress and ordered something else.
・山田君を見かけたらつかまえておいてくれ.　If you see Yamada, don't let him go.
・年上をつかまえてその口の利き方はないだろう.　You know you're not supposed to talk like that to an older person.
3 〔放さないようにする〕 take [get, catch, lay] hold of sth; clutch; grasp.
►首根っこをつかまえる　hold sb by the scruff of his neck
・袖口をつかまえる　grab [clutch] sb's sleeve; grab sb by the sleeve
・目の前のロープをつかまえる　grasp a rope in front of one
・つかまえている　hold 《onto…》; hold on…; keep a hold on….
►ニワトリが逃げないようにしっかりつかまえていなさい.　Hold on tight to the chicken so it doesn't run away.

つかまりだち【掴まり立ち】 [ローマ字](tsukamaridachi)
〜する 〔赤ん坊が〕 can stand up holding onto something.

つかまる【捕まる・掴まる・捉まる】 [ローマ字](tsukamaru)
1 〔拘束される〕 be caught; be captured; 〔逮捕される〕 be arrested; be apprehended; be taken prisoner; 《口》 be nabbed.
►(鬼ごっこで)鬼につかまる　be caught by "it"
・酒気帯び運転でつかまる　be caught driving drunk
・横領でつかまる　be arrested for embezzlement
・つかまらずに逃げおおせる　get away with 《a crime》
・つかまらずにいる　keep out of sb's clutches.
►ネズミは猫につかまった.　The mouse was caught by the cat.
・亜紀さんもとうとう上田君につかまって結婚するそうだ.　Aki was finally caught by Ueda, and they're going to get married.
・犯人はまだつかまっていない.　The criminal is still ┏loose [at large].
・ついに彼も警察につかまった.　The law finally caught up with him.
2 〔居場所が知れる〕 be located; (対面する) 《be able to》 meet sb; 〔呼び止められる〕 be caught; 〔引き留められる〕 be stopped.
►ようやく担当者がつかまった.　〔連絡が取れた〕 I finally ┏got in touch with [reached, was able to contact, 《口》 got hold of] the person who is handling that. ｜ 〔対面できた〕 I finally was able to meet the person who is handling that.
・きょうはタクシーがすぐにつかまった.　Today I ┏caught [flagged down] a cab quickly.
・あいつにつかまったら逃げられない.　Once he gets ahold of you, you'll never be able to get away.
・友人につかまって話し込まれてしまった.　I ┏was held up [was tied up, got stuck] listening to a friend. ｜ I got buttonholed by a friend.
・出がけに彼につかまってしまった.　I was caught by him just as I was leaving.
3 【野球】 〔相手打線に打ちこまれる〕
►先発投手は 4 回の裏につかまって 5 点を失った.　The starting pitcher was ┏battered [pounded, touched] for five runs in the bottom of the fourth inning.
4 〔しっかり握る〕 hold [hang] on to…; clutch; cling to….
►手すりにつかまる　hold on to the handrail
・つり革につかまる　hold [hang] on to a strap
・(倒れないように)しっかりつかまっている　hold on tight 《to sth》; keep a firm hold on…
・つかまりそこなう　be unable to grab 《(onto) a strap》.
►私の肩につかまりなさい.　Hold on to my shoulder.
・あの子は母親につかまって離れない.　That child ┏hangs on to her mother and won't let go [is stuck to her mother like glue].

・この家にはテラスがついている.　This house has a terrace.
・エアコンにはタイマーがついている.　The air conditioner has a timer.
・この劇場には保育室がついている.　This theater has a childcare room.
・彼は中年になって貫禄がついてきた.　He has acquired dignity in middle age.
4 〔程度・数量が増す〕 gather; gain; accumulate.
►はずみがつく　gather [gain] momentum
・利子がつく　bear [yield] interest
・この奨学金は年 5 パーセントの利息がつく.　Five percent interest is charged on this student loan.
・加速(度)がつく　accelerate; 〔勢いがつく〕 gather [gain] momentum; get a boost
・チームの攻撃にスピードがついてきた.　The team's offense has ┏speeded up [gained speed, become faster].
5 〔(遅れずに)従う〕 follow; 〔付いて離れない〕 tag on. [⇒ついていく]
►登山の一行について私も富士山に登った.　I joined a group of hikers to climb Mt. Fuji.
・彼は先頭集団について走っている.　He's running with the leading group.
6 〔付き添う〕 accompany; go with…; 〔味方になる〕 ally oneself with…; 〔後ろ盾になる〕 back up; support.
►護衛がつく　be under guard
・付き添いがつく　be escorted
・弁護士がつく　be represented by a lawyer
・強い味方がつく　get a strong ally
・買い手がつく　find a buyer.
►旅先ではガイドがついた.　We had a guide at our destination.
・患者には一日じゅう看護師がついていた.　The patient was under the care of nurses all day long.
・私がついていながら娘にけがをさせてしまった.　Even though I was with her, I let my daughter get hurt.
・君には立派な両親がついているじゃないか.　You're supported by your good parents, aren't you?
・君がついていれば安心だ.　I feel secure in your company.
・私がついているから安心しなさい.　I'm here, so don't worry. ｜ Make yourself easy. You have a friend in me.
・先方には優秀な税理士がついている.　They have an outstanding tax accountant.
・彼が味方についてくれた.　He took our side.
・どちらの側にもついてはいけない.　You should take neither side.
・〔夫婦喧嘩などで〕 娘も息子もいつも母親につく.　My daughter and son always take their mother's side.
・われわれの企画にはスポンサーがついた.　Our project has acquired a backer.
7 〔記される〕 be marked; be indicated.
►赤点がつく　get a failing ┏*score [ᐦmark]
・成績表に A がつく　get an A on one's report card
・名簿に赤鉛筆で印のついている人　people (whose names are) marked with a red pencil on the roster.
►解答にバツがついていた.　My answer was marked wrong.
・先発投手に勝ち星がついた.　The starting pitcher got the win.
・血圧測定で要注意のマークがついてしまった.　My blood pressure was indicated as requiring attention.
・金の出入りは帳簿についている.　Our cash flow is recorded in the account books.
・みんなのコーヒー代が君についているよ.　Everyone's coffee is on your bill.
・彼の発言内容には疑問符がつく.　His statement is ┏dubious [doubtful].
・開店時刻を早めるように注文がついた.　We were asked to open the store earlier.
8 〔割り振られる〕 be allocated; be assigned.
►調査に予算がついた.　Money was ┏allocated to [budgeted for] the survey.
・リア王の役がつく　be cast in the role of King Lear.
9 〔めざす状態になる〕
►燗がついた.　The sake has warmed up.
・ちょうどよく塩味がついた.　It's salted just right.
10 〔可能となる・及ぶ〕
►見当がつく　suppose; guess; 《口》 figure
・想像がつく　be able to [can] imagine
・判断がつく　judge; see; tell.
►この先はまったく予想がつかない.　There's no way to tell [I have no idea] what will happen next.
・私にはイタリア語とスペイン語の区別がつかない.　I can't tell the difference between Italian and Spanish.
・理屈はどうにでもつくものだ.　Anything can be rationalized.
・説明のつかない現象もある.　Some phenomena cannot be explained.
11 〔決定する・決着する・つながる〕
►決心がつく　decide; resolve
・格好がつく　⇒かっこう３ 1, 2
・きまりがつく　be ┏settled [concluded]; be brought to an end
・収拾がつく　come under control; settle down
・勝負がつく　be decided
・連絡がつく　reach [contact] 《sb》.
►その問題にはけじめがついた.　The problem was resolved ┏properly [as it should have been].
・先方の担当者とコネがついた.　I've established contacts with the person in charge there.
・その業者には渡りがついている.　We have a connection to that company.
・銀行とは話がついている.　I've reached an ┏agreement [understanding] with the bank.
12 〔ある値段になる〕 cost; be priced at….
►その中古車に 300 万円の値がついている　The used car is priced at \3 million. ｜ The price of the used car is three million yen.
・競売でよい値がついた.　It fetched a good price at auction.
・その壺には値がつかなかった.　They didn't get any bids for the urn.
・工事は予想より高くついた.　The construction cost more than expected.
・結局は(作るより)買うほうが安くつく.　It'll end up being cheaper to buy (than to make).
・これはアメリカでは 40 ドルにつく.　This would cost $40 in the US.
・その仕事は平均すると(収入が)1 日 2 万円につく.　That work pays an average of \20,000 per day.
13 〔運が向く〕 have (some) good luck; be lucky. [⇒ついて(い)る]
►つきまくる　⇒つきまくる.
►つかない[ついていない]ときは何をやってもだめだ.　When you're out of luck, nothing goes right.

つく３【吐く】 [ローマ字](tsuku)
►息をつく　⇒いき３ 2
・一息つく　⇒ひといき 2
・うそをつく　⇒うそ 1.

つく４【即く】 [ローマ字](tsuku)
〔即位する〕
►王位[帝位]につく　ascend to [accede to, take] the ┏throne [imperial throne].
►国王は第 2 王子を王位につかせて退いた.　The king ceded the throne to his second son.

つく５【突く・衝く・撞く】 [ローマ字](tsuku)
1 〔とがった先で刺す〕 pierce, stick; (ナイフで) stab; (針などで) prick; (角・きばで) gore; (やりで) spear; lance; 〔先がぶつかる〕 strike (against…).
►軽く肩先を突く　stick ┏sb's [sb in the] shoulder lightly
・ぐさりと心臓を突く　stab [strike] sb in the heart 《with a knife》; thrust 《a knife》 into sb's heart
・魚を突きに行く　go spearfishing
・天を突く摩天楼の群れ　soaring skyscrapers.
►その闘牛士は角で突かれた.　The matador was gored.
2 〔押しつける〕 push; thrust; give a ┏push [thrust]; (指・棒で) poke; (棒切れなどで) prod; (頭で) butt; (ひじで軽く) nudge; elbow.
►横腹を突く　poke sb [give sb a poke] in the ribs
・指で額を突く　tap sb on the forehead with one's finger
・(親しげに) ひじでそっと突く　give a friendly nudge
・書類に判を突く　stamp one's seal on a document.
3 〔(刺激などが) 突然襲う〕
►ガスのにおいが鼻を突いた.　The smell of gas stung my nose.
・異様な臭気が鼻を突いた.　An offensive smell assailed my nostrils.
・悲しみが胸を突いた.　I was ┏struck [overcome] with sorrow.
・言葉が口を突いて出た.　Words ┏rushed to [poured from] his lips. ｜ He blurted something out.
4 〔ねらいすます〕 take aim at…; 〔攻める〕 attack; assail; (突撃する) charge (at)….
►核心を突く　get to the point; touch the core; get to the heart of the matter
・弱点を突く　take advantage of sb's weak point
・その弱点を突かれる　be attacked at that most vulnerable point
・痛いところを突かれた.　She hit me in my weak spot.
・法律の盲点を突く　exploit loopholes in the law
・不意を突かれる　be caught off guard
・一瞬のすきを突く　take advantage of a momentary chance; seize an opportunity
・敵の背後を突く　attack the enemy ┏from [in] the rear.
►この広告は買い物客の心理を巧みに突いている.　This advertisement skillfully ┏uses [utilizes, takes advantage of] the psychology of shoppers.
・わが部隊は敵の右翼を衝いた.　Our forces pressed at the enemy's right flank.
5 〔障害を顧みない〕 brave 《a storm, dangers》.
►風雨を突いて進む　advance in the face of wind and rain; make one's way through a storm.
►一行は嵐を突いて出発した.　The group set out into the storm.
・列車は闇を突いて走った.　The train sped through the darkness.
6 〔支えにする〕
►机にひじを突く　rest one's elbow on a desk.
►彼女はひざを突いて子供に話しかけた.　She knelt down and spoke to the child.
・彼は両手に松葉杖を突いていた.　He had crutches under both arms. ｜ He was walking on crutches.
7 〔跳ね返らせる〕 bounce.
►まりを突く　bounce a ball
・ボールを突きながら走る　run while ┏bouncing [dribbling] a ball
・(羽子板で)羽を突く　hit a shuttlecock.
8 〔打って鳴らす〕 strike; bang.
►鐘を突く　ring [strike, toll] 《a bell》.
9 〔玉突きの〕 hit; knock.
►君は突くのが下すぎる.　You put too much "bottom" on your ball.
・少し突こうか.　Do you want to knock the balls around a bit?

つく６【点く】 [ローマ字](tsuku)
〔発火する〕 ignite; catch fire; start burning; 〔稼働する〕 start; turn on; begin operating.
►カーテンに火がついた　The curtain caught fire.
・電気がついている.　The electric light is on.
・ランプがついた.　The lamp lit up.
・日が暮れると街灯がつく.　When it gets dark, the streetlights ┏switch [turn, go] on.
・エアコンが壊れてつかない.　The air conditioner is broken and won't ┏turn on [work].
・このガスコンロはつきにくい.　This gas burner is hard to light.
・わが家は一日じゅうテレビがついている.　At our home, the television is on all day long.

つく７【浸く】 [ローマ字](tsuku)
be submerged; get wet.
►床下[床上]まで水がついた.　The water reached ┏below [above] the floor.

つく８【就く】 [ローマ字](tsuku)
1 〔就職する〕 be ┏hired [employed] 《as…》; 〔就任する〕 become [be appointed, be made] 《a director》.
►任に就く　take office; take up one's post; be installed in an office
・教職に就く　become [begin working as] a teacher; enter the teaching profession
・役職に就く　take a managerial position.
►仕事に就きたくても職場がない.　Even if I wanted to get a job, there's no place to work.
・彼はまだ定職に就いていない.　He doesn't have a regular job yet.
2 〔身を置く〕
►眠りに就く　fall asleep
・警備に就く　stand guard
・守備に就く　〔野球〕 take the field; 〔サッカーなど〕 play defense
・兵役に就く　enter [join, go into] the military
・帰途に就く　leave for home; start on a homeward journey
・世界周航の途に就く　start [set out] on a voyage around the world.
►社員たちは持ち場についた.　The employees went to their posts.
・床についたまま眠れずにいた.　I went to bed but couldn't fall asleep.
・そのとき私はすでに家路についていた.　I was already on my way home then.
・遅くなったので急いで帰途についた.　As it was getting late we started for home with all speed.
3 〔師事する〕 study ┏with… [under…]; be a ┏student [disciple] of…; 〔身を寄せる〕 live [stay] with…; (従う) go with…; accompany; 〔沿う〕 follow. [⇒ついてくる 1]
►専門家に就いて勉強する　study ┏under [with] a specialist
・(両親の離婚で)母親に就く　live with [go with, be taken by] one's mother
・易きに就く　take the easy way out.
►声楽は小山先生に就いている.　I'm studying voice with Ms. Koyama.
・大学では加藤先生に就いていた.　I studied under Prof. Katō in college.
・その家ならこの塀に就いて左に曲がったところです.　Follow this wall and turn left. The house is right there.
4 〔関わる〕 ⇒-について, -につき.

つく９【着く】 [ローマ字](tsuku)
1 〔目的地に至る〕 arrive 《at…》; reach; get to…; 〔配達される〕 be delivered 《to…》.
►(電車が)駅に着く　arrive at [pull into] a station
・正午に広島に着く　arrive at [reach] Hiroshima at noon.
►家に着くのは夜中になる.　We won't get home until the middle of the night.
・ロンドンには何時に着きますか.　What time do we ┏arrive in [reach, 《口》 get to] London?
・ほら, (目的地に)着いたよ.　Look, we're there.
・いま博多に着いた.　I just arrived in Hakata.
・〔タクシーで〕 お客さん, 着きましたよ.　Here you ┏are [go].
・速達ならあした着きます.　If you send it by express, it'll get there tomorrow.
・宅配で荷物が着いた.　The luggage ┏came [was delivered] by parcel delivery service.
・君からの手紙がまだ着かない.　Your letter hasn't arrived yet.
・そのはがきは結局彼に着かなかった.　The postcard never reached him.
・私の電子メール, 着きましたか.　Did you get my e-mail?
2 〔届いて触れる〕 reach; touch.
►彼は頭が鴨居に着く.　His head ┏reaches [touches] the lintel.
・川は足が着く程度の深さだった.　The river was shallow enough ┏for my feet to touch bottom [for me to stand].
・(プールの底などに) 足が着かないよ.　My feet don't touch the bottom.
・〔野球で〕 ベースに足が着いている.　He has a foot ┏on [touching] the base.
・〔相撲で〕 横綱の手が先に土俵に着いた.　The yokozuna's hand hit the ring first.
3 〔位置を占める〕.
►席に着く　take one's seat; sit down
・スタートラインに着く　get set [line up] at the starting line
・列の最後尾に着く　get [fall in] at the end of the line.

つくす【尽くす】 [ローマ字](tsukusu)
1 〔献身的に努力する〕 serve sb; work 《for a cause》; render 《service to…》; exert oneself; endeavor 《to do》.
►夫[妻]に尽くす　serve [do a lot for] one's ┏husband [wife]
・国家に尽くす　serve one's country; place oneself ┏at [in] the service of one's country
・社会に尽くす　serve [work for] society
・正義のために尽くす　work for justice
・公益のために尽くす　labor for the public good
・その仕事に大いに尽くす　work hard on the job; devote a lot of time to the job
・わが身を顧みず人のために尽くす　serve others ┏without a thought for oneself [unselfishly]
・女性に尽くす男性　a ladies' man
・男性に尽くす女性　a woman who devotes herself to men.
►君はわが社のためによく尽くしてくれた.　You've done a lot for our company.
・彼女は家族に尽くせるだけ尽くした.　She did everything she could for her family.
・(結婚したら)奥さんに尽くすタイプの男だ.　He's the kind of man who would be a devoted husband.
2 〔すべて使い切る〕 use up; run out of…; 〔すべて表す〕 express completely; 〔全うする〕 fulfill; carry out; 〔極に達する〕 do everything; do to the utmost of one's power.
►手[手段]を尽くす　try [exhaust] every means; try everything; do everything ┏in one's power [at one's disposal]
・全力を尽くす　make an all-out effort
・百方力を尽くす　do everything in the book
・力を尽くして戦う　fight as hard as one can
・一言にして尽くす　put [express] 《a matter》 in a nutshell; sum up in one word
・本分を尽くす　do one's duty
・言葉を尽くして説得する　use all of one's powers of persuasion
・努力の限りを尽くす　do one's best; try as hard as possible
・悪事の限りを尽くす　commit all manner of evil
・ぜいたくの限りを尽くす　live to the limits of luxury.
►彼には礼を尽くして接した.　I treated him with the utmost courtesy.
・演説時間が短く意の尽くせない部分もあった.　The time allotted for my talk was too short for me to say everything I had intended. [⇒い１０ (意を尽くす)]
・あらゆる場合がこの条項に尽くされている.　All possible circumstances are covered by this clause.
・君はまだ義務を尽くしていない.　You haven't done everything that you're supposed to do yet.

-つくす【-尽くす】 [ローマ字](-tsukusu)
►食べ尽くす　eat up
・飲み尽くす　drink up; drink to the bottom 《of a glass》
・歩き尽くす　travel ┏all over [throughout] 《a country》; travel the length and breadth 《of a country》
・書き尽くす　write completely; write everything
・論じ尽くす　discuss 《a subject》 ┏fully [at length, from every angle]
・語り尽くせないほどの思い　feelings that are more than one can express.
►裏山のワラビは採り尽くした.　The bracken on the hill behind our home has all been ┏harvested [picked].
・このあたりの銀は掘り尽くした.　The silver around here has been played out.
・言いたいことはすべて言い尽くした.　I said everything I wanted to say.
・意見が出尽くしたようなので, この辺りで決を採ります.　Everyone seems to have expressed their opinions, so we will now take a vote.
・この町のことは知り尽くしている.　I know this town inside and out.
・その小説は 1 か月で 1 万部を売り尽くした.　This novel sold ten thousand copies in one month.
・彼女のことはいくら褒めても褒め尽くせない.　She can't be praised too much. ｜ She is beyond praise.
・これは考え尽くしたすえの結論である.　This is what we came up with after thorough deliberation.
・私はもう道楽はし尽くした.　I've enjoyed every pleasure I could.
・もう涙は出尽くした.　I've cried myself dry.

1 〔貨物や資材を〕 raise; lift; hoist.

2 〔目を〕 narrow one's eyes; glare.
►彼は目をつり上げて怒った.　His eyes narrowed in anger. ｜ He glared angrily.
3 〔価格を〕 force up; boost (up); manipulate 《a price》 upward; *《俗》 jack up.
►相場をつり上げる　rig [inflate] the market.
►一部の業者によって土地の値段がつり上げられている.　Land prices were manipulated upward by some of the traders.
4 〔魚を〕 catch; hook; land.
►彼は次々に大魚を釣り上げた.　He landed one large fish after another.

つりあい【釣り合い】 [ローマ字](tsuriai)
1 〔均衡〕 equilibrium; (重さなどの) equilibrium; balance; proportion; (収支の) balance.
►力の釣り合い　equilibrium of forces
・不安定な釣り合い　【物】 unstable equilibrium. [⇒不安定平衡 (⇒へいこう２)]
►釣り合いが崩れる　equilibrium breaks down
・釣り合いが取れている　be in a state of equilibration; be well-balanced; be in proportion
・釣り合いが取れていない　be out of balance; be out of proportion
・重さの釣り合いが取れている[取れていない].　The weight is ┏balanced [unbalanced].
・資力との釣り合いが取れていない　be out of proportion with one's means.
►釣り合いのよい[取れた]　well-balanced; well-proportioned
・釣り合いの悪い[取れない]　unbalanced; ill-proportioned
・釣り合いの取れた物の見方をする　see things ┏in perspective [with a good sense of proportion]
・釣り合いの感覚　a sense of proportion.
►釣り合いを取る　balance
・釣り合いを取り戻す　recover one's balance; right oneself
・…で釣り合いを取る　be counterbalanced by…
・釣り合いを保たせる　keep sth in balance
・身体の釣り合いを保つ　keep [preserve] one's balance
・釣り合いを失って倒れる　be (thrown) off one's balance; lose one's balance
・(積荷を加減して)船の釣り合いを取る　trim the ship
・帆の釣り合いを取る　trim the sails.
2 〔取り合わせ〕 match; compatibility.
►両家の釣り合い　〔家柄の〕 compatibility between two families.
►じゅうたんとカーテンの釣り合いがよい.　The carpet and curtains are ┏nicely matched [a nice match].
・その芝居は笑いと涙の釣り合いがうまく取れている.　The play is finely balanced between comedy and pathos.
►釣り合いの取れた[取れない]夫婦　a ┏well-matched [poorly-matched] couple.
3 〔均整〕 symmetry.
►釣り合いの取れた体型　a well proportioned figure
・釣り合いの取れた文　a well-balanced sentence; a carefully constructed passage.
◧釣り合いおもり　【機】 counterbalance; counterweight; balance weight.
釣り合い舵　【船】 a balanced rudder.
釣り合い試験　a balancing test.
►釣り合い試験機　a balancing machine.
釣り合いシリンダー　【船】 a balance cylinder.
釣り合い装置　an equalizer; a balancer.
釣り合い梁(ばり)　【鉄道】 an equalizer; an equalizing ┏beam [bar].
釣り合い弁　【機】 a balanced [an equilibrium] valve.

つりあう【釣り合う】 [ローマ字](tsuriau)

・釣り合わせる　(put into) balance.
►よく釣り合っている.　They are a fine match.
・髪型とドレスがよく釣り合っている.　Her hairstyle and dress are well matched.
・二人は年齢が釣り合っている.　They are well-matched in age.
・家具が部屋に釣り合わない.　The furniture ┏is out of keeping [doesn't go well] with the room.
・この茶碗に釣り合う急須がありません.　We have no teapot to match these cups.
・釣り合わぬは不縁のもと.　A poor match leads to divorce. 【諺】

►拙宅を訪ねるよう彼に伝えてください.　Please tell him to come to my home.

・それは彼女の意志を誤って伝えるものだ.　That misrepresents her wishes.

・日米がガイドラインに合意したとワシントンから伝えてきた.　It has been reported [A report has come in] from Washington that the Japanese and American governments have agreed on the guidelines.
・彼らは満足の意を表したと伝えられている.　They reportedly expressed satisfaction.
2 〔届かせる〕 deliver; convey; 〔発信する〕 issue; transmit; 〔感じさせる〕 show; express.
►振動を伝える　transmit [propagate] vibrations.
►銅は熱をよく伝える.　Copper ┏conducts heat well [is a good conductor of heat].
・この映画は見る者に現代人の苦悩を伝えている.　This film shows viewers the bewilderment felt by people today.
・この感動を世界中の人々に伝えたい.　I want people throughout the world to know how I feel.
・惑星探査機は土星の映像を伝えてきた.　The planetary probe sent back images of Saturn.
・その記事は秋の風情を伝えていた.　The article had an autumnal mood.
3 〔もたらす〕 bring 《to…》; introduce 《to…》.
►製鉄の技術を日本に伝えた人たち　the people who ┏brought [introduced] steel manufacturing to Japan.

4 〔伝授する〕 teach; make known; impart; 〔伝承する〕 hand [pass] down; leave; 《文》 bequeath.
►技術を伝える　teach a skill 《to sb》
・秘伝を伝える　initiate sb in the mysteries of an art
・千年来の伝統を今に伝える儀式　a ceremony that preserves a thousand-year-old tradition
・子孫[後世]に伝える　pass ┏down [on] to posterity
・父から子へ[代々]伝える　transmit ┏from father to son [from generation to generation]
・家宝を伝える　bequeath a family heirloom
・名を永久に伝える　have one's name go down in history; immortalize one's name.
►市川家の芸風は父から子へと代々伝えられている.　The performance style of the Ichikawa family has been passed down from father to son for many generations.

2 〔届く〕 reach; 〔感じられる〕 be felt; be seen; come across; (波が) propagate; travel; (音が) travel; be heard; (熱が) be conducted; warm; heat; spread to….

〔職や役が〕 be ┏fit [qualified] for 《a job》; be equal to 《a task》; be able to fulfill the duties 《of…》; function properly.
►だれにでも勤まる仕事　work that anyone ┏is qualified to [can] do
・勤まらない　be ┏unfit [unqualified] for…; be unequal to sth; be incompetent to do; be unable to hold down 《a job》.
►私に教師は勤まらない.　I am unfit to be a teacher. ｜ I am not suited ┏to be a teacher [for teaching].
・君なら十分勤まる会社だ.　It's a company that you are entirely qualified to work in.
・あの社長室にはとても勤まりません.　I am quite unqualified to work in the president's office.
・彼女にマクベス夫人は務まらないだろう.　She is probably unsuited to play Lady Macbeth.
・ここで秘書として勤まればどこへ行っても勤まる.　If you are qualified to work as a secretary here, then you are qualified to work anywhere you go.
・この老舗の主人として勤まるだろうか.　I wonder if I will be able to fulfill the duties required of the master of this long-established shop.

つとめ１【務め】 [ローマ字](tsutome)
〔責務〕 a duty; an obligation.
►国に対する務め　a duty to one's country
・市民としての務め　one's obligations as a citizen.
►務めを果たす　discharge [fulfill] one's duties; do one's ┏part [share]; hold up one's own end; 〔一人前の働きをする〕 《口》 pull one's weight
・務めを怠る　neglect one's duties.

つとめ２【勤め】 [ローマ字](tsutome)
1 〔雇われてする仕事〕 duties; a job; service; business. [⇒おつとめ 3]
►毎日の勤め　daily duties; daily routine.
►土曜日も勤めがある.　I have to work on Saturdays, too.
►勤めから帰る　return [get back] from work.
►趣味(として)でなく勤めとしてやること　something one does ┏as a job, not as a hobby [not as a hobby, but as a job].
►勤めに出る　〔雇われる〕 work ┏in [for] 《a company》; be employed at 《a company》; serve in 《a company》; 〔出勤する〕 leave home for work
・彼女は最近勤めに出るようになった.　She's started working recently.
►勤めを持っている　be employed; have a job
・勤めをはげむ　be ┏assiduous [diligent] in one's duties; work hard at a job
・2 度の勤めをする　come back; stage a comeback; serve again; serve another term
・勤めを休む　stay [be] away from work; take a ┏holiday [vacation]; take time off
・勤めをやめる　quit one's job
・勤めを第一に考える　think of one's job as the most important thing in one's life.
►彼は勤めは忠実にこなしている.　He performs his duties with devotion.
・勤めはつらいものさ.　It is a hard thing to serve.
2 〔勤行(ごんぎょう)〕 a (Buddhist) religious service; 〔読経〕 sutra chanting. [⇒おつとめ 1]
►(仏への)毎日の勤め　a daily Buddhist service.
◧勤め帰り　
►勤め帰りのサラリーマン　a white-collar employee on his way home from work.

つとめあげる【勤め上げる】 [ローマ字](tsutomeageru)
serve (out) one's time; do [perform] one's service; wind up [serve out] one's apprenticeship; serve one's full time.
►2 年の任期を勤め上げる　serve out a two-year term
・30 年間会社一筋に勤め上げる　serve a company with devotion for a full thirty years.
►彼女は定年まで無事に勤め上げた.　She served until retirement age without incident.

つとめぶり【勤め振り】 [ローマ字](tsutomeburi)
one's ┏conduct [attitude] (on the job).
►勤め振りに応じて増給する　increase sb's salary in accordance with his conduct on the job.

つとめぐち【勤め口】 [ローマ字](tsutomeguchi)
a situation; a position; a place; a place of ┏business [employment].
►料理人[運転手]の勤め口　a situation as a ┏cook [chauffeur].
►勤め口が見つかる　find a ┏situation [position]; find employment; get a job
・君にぴったりの勤め口がある.　There's a position that's exactly right for you.
►勤め口を探す　look [search, hunt] for a ┏situation [job]
・もっとよい勤め口を探してあげよう.　I'll find you a better job.

つとめむき【勤め向き】 [ローマ字](tsutomemuki)
one's business; one's duties; 〔勤め先〕 ⇒つとめさき.

つとめにん【勤め人】 [ローマ字](tsutomenin)
an office worker; a salaried worker; an official; a clerk; a white-collar worker.

つとめる１【努める・勉める】 [ローマ字](tsutomeru)
〔目指して励む〕 strive; make an effort to do; put one's efforts into doing; 〔強いてする〕 force oneself to do; insist on doing no matter what. [⇒つとめて]
►製品の値下げに努める　make an effort to lower prices on one's products
・犯人の逮捕に努める　strive to arrest the criminal
・会社の発展に努める　make an effort to expand the company
・国土の緑化に努める　put one's efforts into making the country greener
・興奮するまいと努める　force oneself not to get excited.
►二度とこのようなことがないように極力努めます.　We will make the utmost efforts to ensure that such a thing never happens again.
・家族のためにはずいぶん努めてきたつもりだ.　I feel that I have expended a great deal of effort for the sake of my family.
・私は笑顔でいようといつも努めていた.　I always forced myself to keep a smile on my face.
・国は社会福祉の向上に努めなければならない.　The state shall use its endeavors for the promotion of social welfare.
・彼らはひたすら倹約にこれ努めている.　They earnestly concentrated their efforts on economizing.

つとめる２【勤める・務める】 [ローマ字](tsutomeru)
1 【勤める】 〔雇われて働く〕 serve 《in an office》; hold 《a post, an office》; fill 《a post》; serve under sb; be in the service of 《a company》; have ┏a position [an appointment].
►家電メーカーに勤める　be employed by an electrical appliance manufacturer
・通訳として勤める　serve as an interpreter
・住み込みで勤める　serve in a live-in position
・パートタイムで勤める　be employed part-time.
►夫は銀行に勤めている.　My husband is employed by a bank. ｜ My husband works for a bank.
・どこに勤めていますか.　Where do you work?
・その運転手はよく勤めてくれた.　That chauffeur has served us well.
・私は 10 年間まじめに勤めた.　I served diligently for ten years.
・彼はいまどこにも勤めていない.　He's not employed anywhere now.
2 【勤める】 〔勤行する〕 conduct a religious service; 〔仏事を営む〕 conduct (Buddhist) funeral or memorial rites.
►丸山家の法事を勤める　conduct memorial rites for the Maruyama family.
3 【務める】 〔役目をする〕 discharge [do, perform] one's duty; do one's part.
►議長を務める　serve as Speaker 《of the House of Representatives》
・ジェームズ・ボンド役を務める　perform the role of James Bond
・兵役を務める　perform one's military service
・任期満了まで務める　perform one's duties until the end of one's term
・パーティーでホスト役を務める　do one's duty as host of the party.
►これでも支店長を務めた身だ.　I may not look the part, but I served as head of a branch office.
・本日司会を務める小川健です.　I am Ogawa Ken, who will be performing the role of master of ceremonies today.
・彼女は突然の代役を無事務めた.　She performed her duties as a last-minute substitute without incident.

・勤め先をしくじる　lose one's employment; be dismissed from service; *be fired; ᐦbe sacked.

つとめて【努めて】 [ローマ字](tsutomete)
〔できるだけ〕 as ┏much [far] as one can; as ┏much [far] as possible; to the best of one's ability; 《be》 careful to do; 〔努力して〕 diligently; assiduously; studiously.
►努めて…する　take care to do; be ┏very [especially] careful to do; endeavor [make an effort] to do; go out of one's way to do
・努めて英語で話す　make an effort to speak English
・努めて早く帰宅する　take care to go home early
・努めて明るくふるまう　make an effort to act cheerful.
►彼女には努めてよくしてあげた.　I went out of my way to be nice to her.
・移動には努めて電車を使うようにしている.　To get around I try as much as possible to travel by train.
・旅行中は努めて日本語を使わないようにしていた.　While traveling, I was especially careful not to speak Japanese.
・努めて冷静にしていた.　I made an effort to compose myself.
・そういうことは努めて避けなければならない.　You must try to avoid such things as much as possible.

つとに【夙に】 [ローマ字](tsutoni)

・棒でつつき出す　poke sth out with a stick.

►なべをつつく　pick food out of a pot.
3 〔けしかける〕 instigate; incite; urge; prod; prompt; needle; egg on.
►だれかが陰でつついているんだろう.　Someone must be behind it.
・あいつをつつけばやってくれるさ.　If you give him a ┏push [nudge], he'll do it for us.
4 〔欠点をとりあげる〕 find fault 《with sb, with sth》; 〔弱点をせめる〕 pick on 《sb》.

つつまれる【包まれる】 [ローマ字](tsutsumareru)

・両親の愛情に包まれて育つ　grow up surrounded by the love of one's parents.
►建物は一瞬のうちに炎に包まれた.　The building was instantly enveloped in flames.
・わが家は初夏の緑に包まれた.　My house was surrounded by early summer greenery.
・町は夕闇に包まれた.　The town was enshrouded in evening gloom.
・会場は熱気に包まれていた.　The atmosphere inside the hall was charged with fervent enthusiasm.
・祭りの熱気に包まれて私も叫び出した.　Caught up in the fervent enthusiasm of the festival, I, too, cried out.
・事件は謎に包まれていた.　The incident was shrouded in mystery.
・彼女の生い立ちは秘密のベールに包まれている.　Her early years are veiled in secrecy.

うばう【奪う】 [ローマ字](ubau)
1 〔物を〕 take (by force); snatch [wrest, grab] sth from sb; rob sb of sth; deprive [dispossess] sb of sth; 《口》 swipe sth from sb; (取り上げる) divest sb of 《his office》; (かすめ取る) steal on the sly; 〔権利・特権などを〕 usurp 《a right, a prerogative》.
►人の権利を奪う　deprive sb of his right(s); take away sb's right(s)
・王位を奪う　usurp the throne
・人の愛を奪う　alienate sb from another and turn that affection to oneself; win (over) sb's ┏love [affection]
・活力を奪う　sap sb of his vitality
・(物を)奪われる　be robbed of sth; have sth ┏taken [snatched] away; have sth stolen
・時間を奪う　deprive sb of 《precious》 time
・雇用機会を奪う　deprive sb of employment opportunities
・ヒット 9 本を奪う　grab [snatch, bag] nine hits off 《the pitcher of the opposing team》
・6 個の三振を奪う　grab [bag] six strikeouts
・生命を奪う　take sb's life
・体温を奪う　take away body heat; cause a drop in body temperature.
►その大火で何百人もの生命が奪われた.　The great fire ┏took [claimed] hundreds of lives.
・その大地震によってたくさんの人々の命が奪われた.　A lot of people lost their lives in that big earthquake.
・強盗は私から現金を奪うと一目散に逃げていった.　The thief grabbed my money and ┏ran off at full speed [《口》 hightailed it out of there, was out of there in a flash].
・無名のピッチャーが強豪チームから次々と三振を奪う姿は見事だった.　The sight of an unknown pitcher getting strikeout after strikeout from a powerhouse team was something amazing.
・彼女は不注意から何者かにお気に入りのバッグを奪われた.　Because of carelessness, she had her favorite handbag stolen by someone.
・社内クーデターによって彼は社長のいすを奪われることになった.　As a result of a coup d'état within the company, the president's chair was taken from him.
・事件の衝撃が彼から冷静な判断力を奪った.　The shock of what happened deprived him of the ability to judge ┏coolly [calmly].
・何人(なんぴと)も基本的人権を人から奪うことはできない.　Nobody can take away a person's basic human rights.
・私の叔父は脳梗塞のために, 体の自由を奪われてしまっている.　Because of a stroke, my uncle has lost his freedom of movement.
2 〔心などを〕 absorb 《one's attention》; engross 《one's mind》; 〔魅する〕 fascinate; charm; captivate; enthrall.
►目を奪う　dazzle one's eyes; hold one's gaze; fascinate; captivate
・女性に心を奪われる　be ┏fascinated [captivated, won over] by a woman; be enamored of a woman; lose one's heart to a woman
・音楽に心を奪われる　be ┏enraptured [carried away, enthralled] by (the) music
・観客の心を奪う　enthrall the audience
・彼の芸術的なパスが観衆の目を奪った.　The artistry of his passes held the crowd enthralled.
・彼女の奏でるバイオリンのメロディーが観客の心を奪った.　The melodies she played on the violin ┏enchanted [captivated] the audience.
►彼女は行き交う人々の視線をことごとく奪うほどの美貌の持ち主だ.　She possesses a beauty that attracts the gaze of every single person who passes by.
・彼は新種ウイルスの研究に心を奪われている.　He is ┏engrossed [absorbed] in research on a new type of virus.

・その老婦人は強壮な上に頭がいい.　Besides being in ┏good [robust] health, the old woman has a sharp mind.

・道に迷った上に雨にまで降られた.　We lost our way, and ┏on top of that [to top that, to make matters worse, what was worse, worse still] we got caught in the rain.
・彼の家は広い上に都心にも近い.　His house is big, and ┏on top of that [what's more] it's near the city center.
►彼はブドウ園を案内してくれた上どっさりブドウを私にくれた.　He showed me round the vineyard, and on top of that he gave me a lot of grapes. ｜ He not only took me round the vineyard, but (also) gave me a lot of grapes.

うごかす【動かす】 [ローマ字](ugokasu)
1 〔動きをさせる〕 move; stir; budge.
►彼はそのとき指一本動かさなかった.　He didn't move a finger at the time.
・彼女はかすかに唇を動かした.　She moved her lips slightly.
・そろそろ出番だぞ, 体を動かしておけ.　You'll be going in soon, so warm up.
2 〔移動させる〕 move; shift 《from…, to…》; remove; change the position of….
►たんすを動かすのを手伝ってくれ.　Help me move the chest of drawers.
・君の敗因はこの駒(こま)を動かしたことだ.　You lost when you moved this piece. ｜ You lost by moving this piece.
・ここは駐車禁止ですので車を動かしてください.　This is a no-parking zone, so move your vehicle, please.
・いつもは穏やかなこの川の流れが, こんな巨大な石を動かしたなんて信じられない.　It's hard to believe that this river, which is usually so peaceful, managed to move a giant boulder like this.
3 〔運転する・操作する〕 run; drive; operate; work; 〔機能させる〕 start 《a motor》; set 《a machine》 ┏going [running, in motion]; get 《a machine》 started.
►機械を動かす　set a machine in motion; 〔扱う〕 work [operate] a machine
・車を動かす　operate [drive] a car
・船を動かす　drive [propel] a ship; 〔あやつる〕 manage a boat.
►彼はマウスを動かす手を休めた.　He rested the hand that was ┏operating [handling] the mouse.
4 〔人の心を〕 move; touch; impress; rouse; stir; affect; 〔揺り動かす〕 sway; influence; have an influence on….
►心を動かされる　be ┏moved [touched, stirred, influenced, affected] 《by…》
・動かされやすい　be easily ┏affected [moved, influenced] 《by…》; be susceptible 《to outside influences》; be sensitive 《to criticism, others' opinions》
・どんな誘惑にも心を動かされない　be not moved by any temptation
・お世辞に心を動かされない　be above flattery; be immune to flattery
・人の気持ちを動かす　affect sb's feelings
・人心を動かす　sway [work on] the minds of people; have a great popular influence
・人の心を動かす言葉　stirring [moving] words
・人の心を動かさずにはおかない文章　writing that will not fail to ┏move [stir] the heart of the reader
・あわれみの情に動かされる　be moved by pity.
►彼女のこういった親切がだんだんと彼らの心を動かしていった.　Such kindness on her part gradually ┏moved [touched, stirred] their hearts.
・聴衆は彼の巧みな弁舌にも動かされることはなかった.　The audience was unmoved, even by his skillful eloquence.
・われわれがどんなに頼み込んでも, 彼の心が動かされることはなかった.　No matter how much we pleaded, he was unmoved.
・そう話せば社長の気持ちも少しは動かされるだろう.　If you explain things that way I think you might sway the president a little bit at least.
・彼は少しも心を動かされた様子がなかった.　He didn't look a bit impressed.
・彼はあまりにも目先の利益に心を動かされる.　He is too (much) ┏swayed [influenced] by immediate profit.
5 〔行動させる〕 move 《sb to do》; make sb move.
►兵を動かす　make the troops take action; deploy one's ┏troops [men]
・警察を動かす　move the police 《to take action, to do》
・人を思いのままに動かす　make sb do whatever one wants
・世の中を動かす人　a person who moves the world.
►だれが実際に首相を動かしているのか知る必要がある.　We need to know who really ┏has [holds] the ear of the Prime Minister.
・数十万人に及ぶ署名が政府を動かし, 新しい法律が制定されることになった.　The hundreds of thousands of signatures moved the government to enact a new law.
6 〔変更する・変える〕 change; alter.
►動かしがたい決心　an unshakable [a firm, an unswerving] resolution [resolve, determination]
・動かしえない事実　an ┏undeniable [indisputable, immutable] fact; an incontrovertible fact
・社内の人事を動かす　make personnel changes in a company
・彼はこの課の人事を自由に動かせる立場にある.　He is in a position where he can freely make personnel changes in this ┏section [department].
・時代を動かす力　the ┏ability [power] to ┏change [alter] the times
・心を動かす　change ┏one's [sb's] mind
・親友の忠告が彼の心を動かした.　His close friend's advice changed the man's mind.
►なにものも彼の決心を動かすことはできなかった.　Nothing could ┏shake his resolution [make him change his mind].
・彼はこのチームにとって要(かなめ)であり, 彼のポジションを動かすことはできない.　He is the linchpin of this team, ┏I [we] can't change him to another position.
7 〔運用する〕 manage.
►大金を動かす　manage large sums of money
・資金を動かす　manage funds.

・批判を前向きに受け止める　respond to criticism positively
・庶民の声を真剣に受け止める　take public opinion seriously.
►その若い女性は, 暴漢が切りつけたナイフを, 持っていたかばんで受け止めた.　The young woman stopped her attacker's knife with her handbag.
・キーパーはその強烈なシュートをがっちりと胸で受け止めた.　The keeper stopped the powerful shot squarely with his chest.
・そう言ってくれるのはうれしいけど, 君の気持ちを受け止めることは今の私にはできないんだ.　It's very good of you to say that, but at present I can't reciprocate your feelings. ｜ It's nice of you to say such things, but right now I can't accept your love.

・そうとしか受け取れない.　That is the only way it can be taken. ｜ It cannot be taken otherwise.

・手を挙げない人は参加しないと受け取っていいんですね?　I can take it that anyone who has not put their hand up won't take part, then?

うまぬし【馬主】 [ローマ字](umanushi)

うまパラチフス【馬パラチフス】 [ローマ字](umaparachifusu)
