うまれ【生まれ】 [ローマ字](umare)
〔出生〕 birth; origin; 〔家系〕 lineage; extraction; ᐦfamily; 〔出生地〕 one's birthplace.
►遅[早]生まれ　⇒おそうまれ, はやうまれ
・名門の生まれである　be highborn; be of noble birth; spring from a noble stock; be born with a silver spoon in one's mouth
・卑賤の生まれである　be of low birth; be of humble origin
・外国生まれの　foreign-born; born overseas
・田舎生まれの人　a country-born person
・ハワイ生まれの日本人　a Hawaiian-born Japanese
・アメリカ生まれの人　a person of American birth
・ロンドン生まれの人　a person born in London; a London-born person; someone from London; a Londoner
・ドイツ生まれの米国帰化人　a naturalized American citizen of German birth
・10 月生まれの子　a child born in October.
►生まれから言えばスコットランド人だ.　By ┏birth [origin] he is ┏a Scot [Scottish]. ｜ Originally he is from Scotland.
・自分の生まれから見ればこれでも少しは出世したのです.　Considering [From the point of view of] my ┏birth [origins], I have achieved some success (such as it is) the world.
►彼は自分の生まれにふさわしい地位につけなかった.　He could not attain a rank that ┏suited [became, befitted] his birth.
►生まれのよい　wellborn; of ┏noble [high, good] birth
・生まれの卑しい人　a person of ┏humble origin [mean parentage].
►お生まれはどちらですか.　Where were you born? ｜ Where do you come from? ｜ Where are you from?
・何年(なんねん)生まれですか.　When were you born?
・〔十二支で〕 何年(なにどし)生まれですか.　In what year of the Oriental zodiac were you born? ｜ What year are you? ｜ What's your year?
・彼は大阪の生まれです.　He was born in Osaka. ｜ His birthplace is Osaka. ｜ He hails from Osaka.
◧生まれ育ち　where one was born and ┏brought up [bred, raised].
►私は田舎の生まれ育ちです.　I was born and ┏brought up [bred] in the country.
・彼の生まれ育ちは謎に包まれている.　Where he was born and brought up is shrouded in mystery.

うまれあわせる【生まれ合わせる】 [ローマ字](umareawaseru)
(happen to) be born 《at a certain time》. [⇒うまれる]
►よい星の下に生まれ合わせる　be born under a lucky star.
►こんな時代に生まれ合わせなければ, 彼女も幸せに生きられただろうに.　If only she hadn't ┏been [happened to be] born in times like these, she might have been happy.

うまれあわす【生まれ合わす】 [ローマ字](umareawasu)
＝うまれあわせる.

うまれどし【生まれ年】 [ローマ字](umaredoshi)
the year of one's birth; one's birth year.
►生まれ年で運勢を占う　tell sb's fortune by ┏his birth year [the year of his birth].
►二人は, 生まれ年は同じだが, 学年は違う.　They were both born in the same year, but are in different school years.

うまれかわり【生まれ変わり】 [ローマ字](umarekawari)
〔再生〕 rebirth; new birth; regeneration; 〔輪廻(りんね)〕 transmigration 《of the soul》; metempsychosis; 〔化身〕 an incarnation 《of…》; a reincarnation 《of…》.
►正道への生まれ変わり　a birth unto righteousness.
►この少年は, 先代ダライ・ラマの生まれ変わりだと信じられている.　This boy is believed to be a reincarnation of the previous Dalai Lama.
・この子は, 生まれ変わりではないかと思うほど亡くなったおばあさんによく似ている.　The child looks so much like its late grandmother that ┏she might have been born again [it might be her reincarnated].

うまれかわる【生まれ変わる】 [ローマ字](umarekawaru)
〔再生する〕 be born again; be reborn; be regenerated; 〔魂が〕 transmigrate; be transmigrated; be (re)incarnated; 〔新生する〕 start (one's) life afresh; begin one's life all over.
►生まれ変わったような気持ちになる　feel like a new person; feel as if one ┏were [had been] reborn.
►次の世では男に生まれ変わりたい.　I want to be born a man in my next ┏existence [life].
・この次生まれ変わってくるときには, あの男はネズミかカエルか何かになるぞ.　He will ┏be reborn as [spend the next incarnation in the shape of] a rat, a frog, or some other low animal.
・彼はすっかり生まれ変わった.　He ┏became [has become] a new man. ｜ He is a changed man. ｜ It has made a new man of him.
・顔の整形手術をしたあと, わたしは自分が別の人間に生まれ変わったような気がした.　After cosmetic surgery on my face, I felt as if I'd been reborn (as another person).
・戦後, 日本は平和国家に生まれ変わった.　After the war, Japan reemerged as a peaceful nation.
・家のリフォームをしたら, 快適で安全な住まいに生まれ変わった.　After my house was remodeled, it turned into a convenient, safe dwelling.

うまれこきょう【生まれ故郷】 [ローマ字](umarekokyō)
one's birthplace; the place of one's birth; the place where one was born (and brought up); one's (old) home; (back) home.
►生まれ故郷が懐かしい.　I miss my (old) home.
・この歌をきくと生まれ故郷が目に浮かぶ.　Whenever I hear this song, I can see my hometown in my mind's eye. ｜ This song always reminds me of home.
►彼は 10 年ぶりに生まれ故郷に帰ってきた.　He's come back home for the first time in ten years. ｜ He has returned to the place of his birth after an interval of ten years.
►生まれ故郷の町　one's hometown
・老人はいつか生まれ故郷の日本へ帰りたいと思っている.　The old person wants to go back home to Japan, the place of his birth, some day.
・彼女は今でもときどき生まれ故郷の夢を見る.　She still dreams sometimes of the place where she was born.
►わたしは 15 歳のとき生まれ故郷を出た.　I left my hometown at the age of fifteen.
►その作家の生まれ故郷はどこですか.　Where ┏is that writer [does that writer come] from? ｜ Where was the writer born?

うまれもつかぬ【生まれもつかぬ】 [ローマ字](umaremotsukanu)
►生まれもつかぬ姿になる　gain one's present appearance by accident; become severely ┏disfigured [deformed].
►彼は戦場で負傷し, 生まれもつかぬ姿で国に帰ってきた.　Wounded on the battlefield, he came back severely disfigured.

うまれん【馬連】 [ローマ字](umaren)
【競馬】 ＝うまばんれんしょう.

うまれながら【生まれながら】 [ローマ字](umarenagara)
►生まれながら持っている権利　one's birthright.
►生まれながらに　by nature; naturally
・彼は生まれながらに音感がよかった.　He had naturally good pitch. ｜ He was born with a good ear for music.
・すべての人間は, 生まれながらにして自由であり, 平等な尊厳と権利を有する.　All human beings are born free and equal in dignity and rights.
・彼は生まれながらにして人を引きつける魅力を身につけていた.　He was born with the charm to attract people.
►生まれながらの　born; inborn; inbred; inherent; natural; native; innate; congenital 《deformity》; constitutional 《weakness》
・生まれながらの大富豪である　be born rich; be rich from birth
・生まれながらの詩人　a born poet
・生まれながらの能力　a born talent
・生まれながらの名文家　a natural-born writer
・生まれながらの賢人などというものはない.　No man is born wise.
・彼は生まれながらの科学者だ.　He is a ┏born [natural] scientist. ｜ He was ┏born [cut out, designed, made] to be a scientist. ｜ Nature cut him out for a scientist. ｜ He is a scientist to the manner born.
・彼女には生まれながらの気品というものがただよっている.　There is an air of natural elegance about her.
・あるキリスト教徒たちは, 生まれながらの罪を強く意識している.　Some Christians are deeply conscious of original sin.
・この病気には生まれながらの要素が深くかかわっている.　This illness is closely connected with factors at the time of birth.
►この子供たちは, 生まれながら日米二つの文化に接している.　These children have been brought up in the cultures of both Japan and America.

うまれおちる【生まれ落ちる】 [ローマ字](umareochiru)
be born; come into ┏the [this] world; utter one's first cry. [＝うまれる]
►彼女は生まれ落ちてこのかた, 貧乏というものを味わったことがない.　Ever since the moment of her birth she has not once experienced poverty.
・彼は今, 生まれ落ちて以来経験したことのない苦悩の中にいた.　He was now experiencing greater agony than at any time since he was born. ｜ He had never suffered such distress in his whole life.
・彼女は, この世に生まれ落ちたときから幸運に見放されている.　She has been deserted by good fortune [Fortune has not smiled on her] from the moment she came into this world.

うまれる【生まれる・産まれる】 [ローマ字](umareru)
be born; come into ┏being [existence, the world]; see the light (of day); arrive; 〔生じる〕 result 《from…》; issue 《from…》; be a ┏result [product] 《of…》.
►生まれた場所　one's birthplace; the place of one's birth; (the place) where one was born
・生まれた家　the house where one was born; the home of one's birth
・生まれた時の境遇　the ┏conditions [circumstances] when one was born
・生まれた時から　from birth; since one's birth
・生まれた日から　from [since] one's day of birth; from [since] the day one was born
・まだ生まれない子　an unborn child; a child yet to be born
・(間もなく)生まれる子　an expected child; a child about to be born
・まさに生まれようとしている新たな国家　a new state in the process of being born
・私が生まれ(落ち)てからこの方　ever since ┏my birth [I was born]; in (all) my born days; in my whole life
・金持ち[富貴]に生まれる　be born rich; be born to wealth; be born with a silver spoon in one's mouth
・貧乏な境遇に生まれる　be born poor; be born to poverty; be born in poor circumstances
・貧しい家に生まれる　be born ┏in [of, to] a poor family
・特別の才能を持って生まれる　be born with special ┏talent [gift]
・生まれたばかりの子供　a newborn baby; a newborn
・死んで生まれた赤ん坊　a stillborn baby; a stillborn
・生まれて初めて　(for) the first time ┏in one's life [since one was born]
・生まれたままの姿で　〔裸で〕 naked; in a state of nature; 《口》 in the clothes one was born in; in one's birthday suit.
►弟のところに子供が生まれた.　A baby was born to my brother('s wife). ｜ My brother and his wife have had a baby.
・月曜日には子供が生まれる予定だった.　The baby was due (to ┏be born [arrive]) on Monday.
・彼[彼女]に子供が生まれた.　He [She] became the ┏father [mother] of a baby.
・彼らには子供が 2 人あって, もう 1 人生まれようとしていた.　They had two children and ┏were expecting another [another was expected, another was on its way].
・彼は生まれた時はとても小さかった.　He was very small at birth.
・生まれた時体重が 3 キロあった.　The baby weighed three kilograms at birth.
・彼は英国人を母として生まれた.　He was born to an English mother.
・持って生まれた性分だからどうなるものでもない.　I cannot help my nature. ｜ It's how I was born, so I can't help it.
・彼は僕が生まれる前から英語の先生をやっている.　He has been a teacher of English since before I was born.
・哺乳動物では子供がいっぺんにたくさん生まれることは珍しくなく, 時には一度に 20 数匹も生まれることがある.　For many young to be born at one time is not uncommon among mammals, with the number of young sometimes running to twenty or more in a litter.
・またタウン情報誌が一つ生まれた.　Another town information magazine has ┏appeared [been issued].
・その発明は必要から生まれた.　That invention was born of necessity.
・桃から生まれた桃太郎の話は, 昔からあるおとぎ話だ.　The story of Momotarō, the boy born from a peach, is an ancient folktale.
・わたしは女に生まれてよかった.　I'm glad I was born a woman.
・おれなんか生まれてこなければよかったのだ.　I wish I had never been born. ｜ It would be better if I hadn't been born.
・彼は 1989 年 12 月 31 日に生まれた.　He was born on December 31, 1989.
・彼女は東京の郊外に生まれた.　She was born in the suburbs of Tokyo.
・お前はこの病院で生まれたんだよ.　You were born in this hospital, you know. ｜ This is the hospital where you were born.
・このテレビ番組からまた新しいスターが生まれた.　From this TV program another new star has been born.
・その時から二人の間に愛が生まれた.　Their love was born from that time on.
・この言葉は, 生まれてはすぐ消える流行語の一つにすぎない.　This is only a popular expression that will die out as soon as it sees the light of day.
・音楽が流れ始めると, よい雰囲気が生まれた.　As the music began to play, a pleasant atmosphere arose.
・このパーティーから何組かのカップルが生まれるだろう.　Some new couples will probably be formed at the party.
・その話を聞いて, わたしには一つの疑問が生まれた.　When I heard what was said, one problem occurred to me.
・病状についてもっとわかりやすく説明してくれなければ, 患者の医師に対する信頼は生まれない.　Unless their conditions are explained more clearly, patients will not develop any confidence in their doctors.

うまれそだつ【生まれ育つ】 [ローマ字](umaresodatsu)
be born and ┏brought up [bred, raised].
►ここが父の生まれ育った町だ.　This is the town where my father was born and brought up.

うまれたて【生まれ立て】 [ローマ字](umaretate)
►生まれたての　newborn; newly born
・生まれたての小猫　a newborn kitten; a kitten still wet from ┏birth [its mother]
・生まれたての街　a newly built district.

うまれつき【生まれ付き】 [ローマ字](umaretsuki)
1 〔もって生まれた性質〕 one's nature; one's character; one's disposition; one's temperament.
►祖母は生まれつきのお人好しだった.　My grandmother had a good-natured disposition. ｜ My granny was kindhearted by nature.
・あの女優の演技力は生まれつきの才能だ.　That actress has acting in her nature. ｜ She is a born actress.
・その子供は生まれつきの病気のため歩くことができなかった.　Sick from birth, the child could not walk.
・好奇心が強いのは私の生まれつきの性分だ.　A strong curiosity is part of my ┏character [disposition, nature, temperament].
►芸術的能力には生まれつきという以外に説明がつかないものがある.　Some aspects of artistic talent cannot be explained by anything other than birth.
・目の色は生まれつきだから, 変えようがない.　The color of your eyes is something you're born with, and, it can't be changed.
・3 人は, そろって不幸な生まれつきだった.　All three of them were born to misfortune.
・彼が運動が得意なのは生まれつきだ.　He is a ┏born [natural] sportsman. ｜ He was made ┏for sport [to be a sportsman].
2 〔生まれた時から・生来〕 by nature; naturally; constitutionally; by constitution. [⇒うまれながら]
►生まれつき天分の豊かな人　a naturally ┏gifted [talented] person
・生まれつき正直である　be honest by nature
・生まれつき虚弱だ　be of a delicate constitution
・生まれつき気が小さい　be born meticulous.
►彼は生まれつき体が丈夫だ.　He is naturally fit.
・彼は生まれつき役者になる運命にあった.　He was ┏born [made] to be an actor.
・彼女には生まれつきダンスの才能があった.　She was born with a talent for dancing. ｜ She had an innate talent for dancing. ｜ She was a natural dancer.
・あの少女は生まれつき色が白いのだ.　She was born with light-colored skin.
・彼女の夫は生まれつき冷たい人間だった.　Her husband was cold by nature.
・彼は生まれつき活力に満ちていた.　He was born with vitality.

うまれつく【生まれ付く】 [ローマ字](umaretsuku)
►幸運に生まれつく　be born under a lucky star
・悲運に生まれつく　be born to sorrow.
►彼女はまるで教師に生まれついているかのようだった.　She seemed to be a born teacher. ｜ She seemed to have been ┏born [cut out, designed, made] to be a teacher. ｜ Nature seemed to have cut her out for a teacher. ｜ She was a teacher to the manner born.
・こんな環境に生まれついた子供たちの将来が心配だ.　The future of children born to such circumstances is a matter for concern.
・僕は自然の中で暮らすように生まれついているんだ.　I was born to live in natural surroundings.
・彼はきゃしゃに生まれついていた.　He was born delicate.

・三つ子を産む　have [give birth to] triplets

・彼女はもう子供を産めるような年齢ではない.　She is past the childbearing age.

・このニュースは各方面でいろいろな臆測を生んだ.　This news has given rise to a variety of conjectures in many quarters.

・運のいいやつ　a lucky ┏guy [fellow, dog, bastard, SOB]

うら２【裏】 [ローマ字](ura)
1 〔おもての反対側の見えない部分〕 the back 《of a mirror》; the ┏other [back, reverse] side 《of…》; the wrong side 《of an exam paper》; 〔下面〕 the ┏bottom [underside, lower surface] 《of…》; 〔内面〕 the ┏inside [inner side, inner surface] 《of…》.
►足の裏　the ┏sole [bottom] (of a foot)
・靴の裏　a sole
・硬貨の裏　the ┏back [reverse] of a coin
・封筒の裏　the ┏back [reverse] of an envelope.
►〔コイン・トスで〕 裏が出たら君が先に行け[やれ].　If it's tails, you go first.
►そのページの裏に　on the ┏back [other side] of the page; overleaf; on the reverse
・〔薬の包装箱で〕 用法は裏に記載.　Directions for use on the back of the box.
・カードを受け取ったら裏にして, こちらに見えないようにしてください.　〔手品師の指示〕 After taking a card, turn it face down so that I can't see it.
►華やかな舞台を裏で支える人たちがいる.　There are people behind the scenes who make possible the splendor of the stage. ｜ The magnificent spectacle is made possible thanks to the labors of people behind the scenes.
►裏を返す　〔裏返しにする〕 ＝うらがえす
・〔調理法の説明で〕 表面に気泡ができ始めたら裏を返してよく焼きます.　When bubbles start to appear on the upper surface, turn it over and cook it until it is well done.
・私が税務署員だと知ると, 手の裏を返したように彼らの応対が変わった.　When they found out that I was with the tax office ┏they suddenly treated me quite differently [their attitude (to me) suddenly changed].
・(靴などの)裏を張り替える　resole 《a shoe》; put a new sole ┏on [on 《a shoe》]
・それから彼はそのレコードの裏をかけた.　Then he put on the other side of the record.
・裏を見よ.　〔表示〕 PTO (＝please turn over). ｜ See overleaf. ｜ *Over.
►〔コイン・トスで〕 表か裏か?　Heads or tails?
2 〔陰・背後に隠された部分〕
►この事件には何か裏があるような気がしてならない.　I can't help feeling that there is more to ┏this [this incident] than meets the eye.
►今回の密輸事件はある大きな組織が裏で手引きしていたらしい.　Some large organization apparently arranged this smuggling operation ┏behind the scenes [offstage].
・彼女はわれわれの前ではにこにこしているが, 裏では何を言っているかわからないよ.　She's always very smiley in our presence, but we don't know what she says ┏when we're not there [behind our backs].
・あの会社の社長は単なるお飾りで, 裏で実権を握っていたのは重役たちであった.　The president of the company was just a figurehead. Behind the scenes it was the directors who held power.
►彼がアメリカ行きを断念した裏には, 子供の就学問題があった.　The real reason he dropped the idea of going to America was because of his children's schooling. ｜ Behind his decision not to go to America there lay the problem of his children's education.
►あの時は彼の言葉の裏の意味がわからなかった.　At the time I didn't understand what he was ┏trying to say [implying, getting at]. ｜ I didn't realize then ┏what was behind [the hidden implications of] his words.
・物事にはたいてい裏の裏まであるものだ.　With most things there are wheels within wheels. ｜ There's more to most things than meets the eye.
►心の裏を見透かす　see through sb; see what sb is really up to; realize what sb really wants
・裏を読む　read between the lines; look beneath the surface.
3 〔情報などの裏付け〕 confirmation; evidence; support; backing; corroboration.
►裏を取る　obtain supporting evidence
・それを記事にするからにはちゃんと裏を取れ.　If you are going to write an article on it, ┏get the facts [find out whether it's really true].
4 〔逆〕 the opposite; the reverse; the contrary; 【数・論】 the reverse; the obverse.
►裏を言う　be ironical; say ironically
・裏をかく[行く]　counterplot; foil [outmaneuver, outwit, outsmart, outflank, outfox] 《sb》; foil [defeat, frustrate] 《sb's plans》
・計略の裏をかく　frustrate ┏a plot [sb's designs]; outwit [outsmart] sb; foil ┏sb [sb's plans]
・裏を返せば　to put it the other way around; to look at it from a different angle
・彼女は積極的に意見を言うほうだが, 裏を返せば自己中心的だと言えなくもない.　She's the type who says exactly what she thinks; or you could put it the other way round and say she's self-centered.
・彼の言葉の裏を返せば金が欲しいとということさ.　If you go behind the words, what he's saying is he wants money.
5 〔後ろ〕 the back; the rear.
►(家の)裏へ回る　go round to the back (door).
►裏の小山　a hill ┏at the back of [behind, at the rear of, *《口》 back of] sb's house.
►この道は銭湯の裏を通って大通りに抜ける.　This road goes behind the bathhouse and then leads out into ┏a [the] main road.
6 〔衣服などの〕 a lining; an ┏inner [inside] lining.
►上着の裏　the (inner) lining of a jacket.
►裏付きの[裏を付けた]コート　a lined coat; a coat with a lining.
►毛皮の裏がついている　lined with fur; fur-lined 《gloves》.
►裏をつける　give 《a jacket》 a 《silk》 lining; line 《a coat with fur》.
7 【野球】 the ┏second [lower, last] half; the bottom.
►3 回の裏　the second half of the third inning.
►5 回の裏に入る　go into the bottom of the fifth.

うそ１【嘘】 [ローマ字](uso)
1 〔虚言〕 a lie; 《口》 (ささいな) a fib; 《文》 a falsehood; an untruth; 〔作り事〕 (an) invention; (a) fabrication; a fiction; 〔本当でないこと〕 untruth; falsity; falseness; 《文》 mendacity.
►悪意のある嘘　a ┏malicious [black] lie; a lie intended to cause trouble
・真っ赤な[甚しい]嘘　a ┏complete [total, downright, barefaced] lie; a pack of lies; a ┏pure [total] fabrication; 《口》 a whopping lie; a whopper. [⇒おおうそ]
・真っ赤な嘘をつく　tell ┏a total [a complete, an utter] lie; tell a pack of lies; lie through one's teeth; lie ┏outrageously [shamelessly]
・見えすいた嘘　a ┏transparent [palpable] lie [falsehood]
・もっともらしい嘘　a plausible lie; 《口》 a good story
・しらじらしい嘘　an obvious [a blatant, a barefaced] lie
・罪のない嘘　〔善意の〕 a white lie; 〔たわいない〕 an innocent lie; a harmless fib.
►嘘と実(まこと)　truth and ┏falsehood [lies]; what is true and what is ┏false [a lie]
・嘘みたいな話　an incredible story
►あいつは嘘がばれても平気な男だ.　He's the sort of person who ┏isn't fazed at all by [is shameless about] being caught lying. ｜ It doesn't worry him a bit to be ┏caught lying [exposed as a liar].
►嘘で固めた話　a web of lies.
►いい加減にしろ! 嘘にも程がある.　Now you are going too far! ┏You can only tell so many lies. [There's a limit to how many lies you can tell].
・寂しくないと言えばうそになる.　I'd be lying if I said I wasn't lonely.
・そんなの嘘に決まってる.　That can't be true.
►嘘の　false; untrue; fake 《explanation》; mendacious 《account》
・嘘のかたまり　a pack of lies; a tissue of ┏lies [falsehoods]; one lie after another
・嘘のような高値　an unbelievably high [a fabulous] price
・嘘のような本当の話　an incredible but true story; a case of fact being stranger than fiction
・今日は雲一つないよい天気に恵まれ, 昨日の大雨がまるで嘘のようだ.　With today's wonderful cloudless weather, ┏yesterday's heavy rain seems like a dream [it seems incredible that it rained so hard yesterday].
・嘘の皮をひんむく　expose [reveal] a lie; catch sb out in a lie
・彼は絶対嘘の言えない人だ.　He is absolutely incapable of telling a lie.
►嘘をつく　lie; tell a lie; do not tell the truth; say something that is not true; 〔ささいな〕 《口》 fib; tell a fib
・平気で嘘をつく　think nothing of telling a lie; lie without compunction
・まことしやかな嘘を言う　tell a plausible lie; lie plausibly
・嘘をついたと非難する　criticize sb for telling lies
・とてつもない嘘をつく　tell ┏outrageous [monstrous] lies; lie ┏outrageously [monstrously]; 《口》 tell ┏whopping lies [whoppers]
・「それはとても丈夫ですよ」と私は嘘をついた.　"It's very strong," I ┏lied [said untruthfully, fibbed]. ｜ It wasn't true, but I said it was very strong.
・嘘をつけ[言え].　Don't be silly! ｜ Nonsense! ｜ You're kidding (me). ｜ You're having me on. ｜ Come off it! ｜ Don't give me that.
・会社をずる休みするのならもっとうまい嘘をつけばいいのに.　If you're really intending to ┏take a day off work [*《口》 skip work] you'll have to lie ┏better [more convincingly] than that.
・あいつが嘘を並べ立ててるようにも思えないけどなあ.　I don't think it's likely that that guy is simply telling a pack of lies.
・これまで彼には嘘をつき通してきたので, いまさら本当のことは言えない.　I've stuck to the lie ┏this far [all this time]; I can't tell him the truth now. ｜ Having lied to him all this time I can't turn around and tell him the truth at this stage.
・嘘を見破る　see through [penetrate] a lie
・嘘を教える　give sb ┏false [fraudulent, 《口》 phony] information 《about…》; deceive [mislead] sb (intentionally); 《口》 lead sb ┏up [down] the garden path; *《口》 give sb a bum steer
・嘘を言いふらす　spread lies; circulate false rumors.
►嘘は泥棒の始まり.　＝嘘つきは泥棒の始まり. (⇒うそつき)
・どのような場合でも彼は決して嘘はつかない.　He ┏absolutely never [never ever] lies. ｜ He is always absolutely truthful (whatever the situation).
・彼は嘘などつくような男ではない.　He's not the kind of person who tells lies. ｜ He's not a liar. ｜ He doesn't lie.
・彼女が言っていることに嘘はないと思う.　I think she's ┏telling the truth [being honest, being straight]. ｜ I think she means everything she says.
・彼の言うことはまんざら嘘でもないらしい.　Apparently what he says is not ┏complete fiction [a total lie]. ｜ There seems to be some truth mixed in with what he says.
・それはどうも嘘らしい.　Apparently that's ┏wrong [not right, not true]. ｜ That seems to be wrong.
・みな嘘だ. そんなことおれは信じない.　It's all lies. I don't believe a word of it.
・病気というのはまったくの嘘だった.　The illness was completely faked. ｜ He completely faked his illness.
・こら, 嘘こくな. 白状せんかい.　Hey, I want the truth. Cough it up! ｜ 《口》 Quit stalling and come clean.
・いい加減な嘘言うもんじゃありません. もう何もかもお見通しですよ.　Stop telling such ┏silly stories [pathetic lies]. I can see what you're at.
・嘘偽りは一切ございません.　This is the truth and nothing but the truth, I swear. ｜ I promise you I am not hiding anything at all (from you).
・「あー, あのお店閉まってる」「うっそー, せっかく早起きして来たのに」　"It's closed!"―"No [I don't believe it, You're joking, You're kidding]! And I got up early specially to come here!"
・「部長, 離婚したらしいよ」「えー, 嘘でしょ?」　"The boss has got divorced, apparently."―"You're joking [You're kidding, You're not serious, I don't believe it]!"
・今日は嘘みたいに早く会社に着いちゃった.　I got to work unbelievably early this morning. ｜ This morning I reached the company so early you wouldn't believe it.
・「うわー, すっごくいい天気」「うん, ゆうべの嵐が嘘みたい」　"Amazing [How unbelievable]! The weather's fantastic."―"Yes, it's hard to believe there was such a storm last night."
・今はだれでもその秘境へ行けるなんて嘘みたい.　It's ┏incredible [unbelievable, too good to be true] that anyone can now get to that secluded spot.
・「昨日はごめんね, 映画一緒に行けなくて, なんか体調悪くて」「嘘ばっかり, 昨日はデートだったくせに」　"Sorry about yesterday, not coming to the movie with you; I just didn't feel too good."―"Rubbish [Come off it, Don't give me that]! I know you were on a date yesterday."
・それが嘘か実(まこと)かはわかりませんが, 私は息子の言葉を信じるしかありません.　I don't know whether ┏it's true or not [he's telling the truth or not], but ┏all I can do is believe my son [I can only believe what my son says].
・彼の話はなんだか嘘くさい.　What ┏he says [he's saying] somehow ┏sounds fishy [doesn't ring true].
・彼が自分には恋人がいないと言ったのは嘘だったらしい.　He seems to have been lying when he told me he didn't have a girlfriend.

美しくする　make sth ┏beautiful [pretty]; beautify; pretty up.
美しくなる　become ┏beautiful [pretty]; 〈人が主語〉 grow (more) ┏beautiful [lovely, charming].

美しさ　＝び１.
►この画家の魅力は色の美しさだ.　This painter's ┏appeal [charm] lies in the beauty of his colors.
・その一瞬の美しさに息をのんだ.　The ┏beauty [loveliness] that was suddenly revealed ┏took our breath away [was quite breathtaking].
・ここの桜の美しさに魅せられて毎年欠かさず撮影に来る.　The cherry blossoms here are so beautiful that I come to photograph them every year without fail.

うつりばし【移り箸】 [ローマ字](utsuribashi)

うつりぎ【移り気】 [ローマ字](utsurigi)
caprice; fickleness; whim; passing fancy; frivolity; inconstancy; volatility.
〜な fickle; capricious; inconstant; changeable; whimsical; mercurial.
►移り気な性格　an inconstant ┏character [temperament, disposition]
・移り気な人　a ┏fickle [capricious] person; a person of moods; a weathercock
・移り気な人は成功しない.　An inconstant [A fickle, A mercurial] person will not do well in life.

►視聴者というのは移り気で, 何年も人気番組の座を保つのは難しい.　TV viewers are fickle, and it is difficult to retain one's place as a popular program for many years.

うつりごし【移り腰】 [ローマ字](utsurigoshi)
【柔道】 a changing hip throw; a hip shift. [⇒じゅうどう (さし絵)]

うつりかわり【移り変わり】 [ローマ字](utsurikawari)
(a) change; (a) transition; 〔変転〕 mutability.
►季節の移り変わり　the ┏changes [changing, turning] of the seasons
・世の移り変わり　the changes of the times.
►移り変わりがある　undergo changes; be subject to change(s)
・社会の倫理観も, 時代とともに移り変わりがある.　A society's ethical views are also subject to change as times change.
・日本は比較的四季の移り変わりがはっきりしている.　The changes of the four seasons in Japan are relatively clear.
►日本人の洋服着用は, 近代文明への移り変わりの象徴的出来事であると言える.　The adoption of Western clothing by the Japanese people can be ┏seen [described, taken] as a phenomenon symbolic of the transition to modern civilization.

うつりかわる【移り変わる】 [ローマ字](utsurikawaru)
change; shift.
►季節とともに, 窓の外の景色も移り変わる.　Along with the changes of the seasons, the scene outside the window also changes.
・人の心は時とともに移り変わるものだ.　The human heart changes with time.
・言葉の意味は時代に合わせて移り変わる.　The meanings of words change in keeping with the times.
・この小説は, 場面がどんどん移り変わっていくので, 読んでいてときどき筋がわからなくなってしまう.　I sometimes don't know what's going on in this novel, the scenes change so often.

►右側の通行人の写り込みをカットしよう.　Let's trim away the passersby who appear in the right side of the picture.

うつりすむ【移り住む】 [ローマ字](utsurisumu)

・年を取ったら田舎に移り住もうと思っている.　I'm thinking of living out in the country when I get old.

うつりやすい【移り易い】 [ローマ字](utsuriyasui)
1 〔変わりやすい〕 changeable; fickle; transient; mutable.
►大衆の好みは移りやすい.　The fancies of the masses are fickle.
2 〔感染しやすい〕 infectious 《disease》; contagious 《fever》; catching 《disease》; easily spread.
►病原菌は, 小さい子供やお年寄りなど, 抵抗力の弱い者にうつりやすい.　Pathogenic germs easily spread to people with low resistance, such as small children and the elderly.
・笑い[あくび]はうつりやすい.　Laughter [Yawning, Yawn] is contagious.

うつろ【洞・空ろ・虚ろ】 [ローマ字](utsuro)
1 〔うろ・ほら〕 a hollow; a cavity; a void.
►うつろになった木　a hollow tree.
2 【空ろ】 〜な 〔からっぽな〕 hollow; empty.
►彼の笑い声がうつろに響いた.　His laughter rang hollow.
・彼女の仕事はうまく行っていたが, なぜか心はいつも満たされずうつろであった.　She was doing well at her job, but for some reason her heart always felt unsatisfied and empty.
3 【虚ろ】 〜な 〔ぼんやりした〕 vacant; blank.
►うつろな声　a lethargic voice
・彼はぼんやりと, うつろな目つきでこっちを見ていた.　He was looking at me in a vacant-eyed stare.
・彼女はたった一人で, うつろな日々を過ごしていた.　She was spending empty days all by herself.
・彼女はいつもああいううつろな表情を浮かべている.　She always has that vacuous expression on her face.
►その男はろくに食事もしていないらしく, 体はやせ細り, 目もうつろであった.　The fellow didn't seem to be eating properly: his body was emaciated and his eyes were (a) blank.
・彼は彼女の美しさに気を取られ, 心はうつろであった.　Captivated by her beauty, he couldn't think straight.

うつる１【映る・写る】 [ローマ字](utsuru)
1 【映る】 〔投影する〕 be reflected; be imaged; be mirrored; be projected.
►鏡に映る　be reflected in a mirror
・テレビに映っている　be on the television (screen).
►山々が湖水に映っていた.　The mountains were ┏reflected [mirrored] in the lake.
・彼の目には, 彼女の姿しか映っていなかった.　He had eyes only for her.
・アパートの窓に, ぼんやりと人影が映っているのが見えた.　I saw the dim silhouette of a person (reflected) on the apartment window.
・その子は水たまりに映った自分の顔をじっと眺めていた.　The child was staring at the reflection of its own face in the puddle of water.
・彼女の目には私が無責任な人間と映るらしい.　Apparently I come across to her as an irresponsible person.
・着物にちょんまげ頭の日本人の姿は, 当初, 西洋人の目にはとても奇異に映ったことだろう.　The sight of Japanese men in kimonos, topknots on their heads, must have appeared very ┏strange [odd] at first to the eyes of Westerners.
2 〔取り合わせがいい〕 match; suit; go well 《with…》; become; be becoming 《to…》; harmonize 《with…》.
►彼女にはこの色がよく映る.　This color becomes her.
・あの着物は彼女にはさっぱり映らない.　That kimono does not become her at all.
・藤色は彼女の色白の顔によく映る.　The light purple ┏becomes [goes very well with, suits] her fair complexion.
3 〔(写真・映像が)撮れる〕 be taken; come out.
►この写真はとてもよく写っている.　This photo came out very well. ｜ This is a good photograph.
・この写真に写っている女の子は僕の妹です.　The girl in this photograph is my younger sister.
・その映画には山々の美しい景色が映っていた.　The movie had beautiful mountain scenery.
・この使い捨てカメラは安くてよく写る.　This disposable camera is cheap and takes good pictures.
・倉庫の奥底から見つかったフィルムには, 戦後まもないころの貴重な映像が映っていた.　Film found buried under piles of other things in the storage room contained precious pictures from right after the war.

うつる２【移る】 [ローマ字](utsuru)
1 〔移動する〕 move 《to…, from [out of]…》; be transferred.
►私は, 来月中にでも今の家を移ろうと思っている.　I am thinking of moving out of my present house, maybe even next month.
・佐々木さんは, 9 月から東京本社に移る予定です.　Sasaki is due to be transferred to the head office in Tokyo in September.
・あの大学は来年度から八王子のあたりへ移るそうです.　I hear that that university is moving to somewhere around Hachiōji from the start of the next academic year.
・田中先生は, この 4 月から別の病院にお移りになりました.　Since this past April Dr. Tanaka has moved to another hospital.
・いつご新居へお移りですか.　When are you moving into the new house?
2 〔変わる〕 change; shift; 〔転じる〕 pass; turn 《to…》; drift; 〔経過する〕 pass; go by; elapse.
►時が移るとともに　with the passage of time
・他の党に移る　change to a different party
・(話が)次から次へと移る　drift from one ┏topic [subject] to another.
►時が移るのは速い.　Time ┏passes [goes by, rolls on] quickly. ｜ Time flies.
・時世はすでに移っている.　The times have changed.
・世界経済の中心はロンドンからニューヨークに移った.　The center of the world's economy shifted from London to New York.
・彼女の関心は, 女性の地位の問題から政治問題に移りつつある.　Her interest is shifting from the problem of women's status to political problems.
・話題は環境問題に移った.　The topic of conversation ┏turned [shifted] to environmental problems.
・では, 次の章に移りましょう.　Well, let's move on to the next chapter.
・彼は口ばっかりで, なかなか行動に移らない.　He talks a good ┏game [deal] but is very slow to translate words into action.
・たとえわが子でなくても, 一週間も一緒に過ごせば, 情が移るものだ.　Even if it's not your own child, if you spend one week together you become attached to the child.
3 〔しみ付く〕 (色が) stain; rub off onto…; (香りが) cling to…; permeate; spread to….
・色が移るといけないから, 白いものと色ものとは分けて洗濯しなさい.　To avoid staining, wash white things and colored things separately.
・一日その会議に出ると, たばこのにおいがすっかり服に移ってしまう.　If you spend a day at those meetings, ┏the smell of tobacco permeates your clothes [your clothes will smell of tobacco].
4 〔感染する〕 be infected 《with…》; catch; take; contract 《a bad cold》; 〔流行性である〕 be infectious; be contagious; be communicable; be catching.
►子供にジフテリアがうつった.　The child has ┏caught [contracted] diphtheria.
・長年の看病で, 夫の病気が妻にうつってしまった.　After many years of tending her husband, she ended up ┏catching [contracting] his illness.
・知らない間に風邪をうつされてしまっていた.　Before I knew it, I had caught a cold.
・あくびはうつるものだと思いませんか.　Yawning is catching, don't you think?
・先生の趣味が私にもうつった.　My teacher's ┏tastes [likings] have rubbed off on me.
5 〔延焼する〕 spread 《to…》.

わかる【分かる】 [ローマ字](wakaru)

►試験の結果がわかった.　The results of the examination have been announced.

・あの子の父親がだれだかわかった.　We knew who that child's father was.

・洪水の被害の実情はまだわかっていない.　The real extent of the flood damage remains to be confirmed.
・女心はわからないものだ.　One can never understand a woman's heart.

・この中でどれが毒キノコかわかりますか.　Can you tell which of these mushrooms is poisonous?

・顔には見覚えがあるが, どこのだれかわからなかった.　I remembered seeing her somewhere, but I couldn't place her.
・あの兄弟はどちらが兄か一見しただけではわからない.　You can't tell at a glance which is the older of the brothers.
・今の若者は服装だけでは男か女かわからない.　With young people today, you can't tell just from the clothes whether somebody is a man or a woman.
・彼の話はどこまで信じてよいのかわからない.　I wonder how far I can believe him. ｜ I don't know if he is serious about everything he says.
4 〔意味が通じる〕 appreciate; know; make out; 〔気持ちが伝わる〕 understand; realize.
►しゃれがわかる　get (the point of) [see, understand] a joke
・しゃれがわからない　miss the point of a joke

・彼女が何のことを言ったのか私にはさっぱりわからない.　I ┏have no idea [can't make head or tail] of what she told me.
・お気持ちは痛いほどわかります.　I know very well how ┏hurt you must feel [much you must be suffering].
・彼の話はよくわからなかった.　I couldn't get a good idea of what he ┏had [wanted] to say.

・私の気持ちをだれもわかってくれない.　Nobody understands ┏my feelings [how I feel].

・父に言ってもわかってくれないだろうから話をする気がしない.　I don't feel like talking with my father because, even if I tell him about it, I figure he won't be sympathetic.
5 〔自覚する〕 recognize; 〔納得する〕 be convinced; 〔腑に落ちる〕 fathom; understand.
►わかるまで説得する　talk to sb until he is convinced 《of…, that…》.
►私のことは私が一番よくわかっている.　I'm the best judge of myself. ｜ I know about myself better than anyone else.
・彼女は自分のしたことがわかっていないようだ.　She doesn't seem to know what she's done.
・彼は口で言ってわかるような人じゃない.　He isn't the sort of man ┏to [who will] listen to reason.
・よくわかった, これ以上もう何も言わない.　That's enough! I won't say anymore.

・「月曜までに返事をください」「はい, わかりました」　"Let me have your answer by next Monday."―"Yes, certainly."
6 〔十分な情報がある; 予測できる〕 be informed; know; be aware.

・裁判の結果はどうなるかだれにもわからない.　How the trial will ┏go [turn out] is anybody's guess.
・あの会社の倒産はわかっていたことだ.　That company's failure was a foregone conclusion.
・今回の事件はわからないことだらけだ.　The recent incident ┏is riddled with [full of] missing pieces.
・人体にはまだわからないことが多い.　There are a lot of things ┏impenetrable [incomprehensible] about the human body.
・あしたのことなどだれにもわからない.　Nobody knows [There's no way of knowing] what's going to happen tomorrow.
・それがわかれば苦労はないさ.　If I knew that, there wouldn't be any ┏problem [hassle].
・そんな不用意なことを言ったら大騒ぎになることぐらいわからないんですか.　Ain't you aware that such a careless remark from you will create a big stir?
7 〔道理を知る〕 be sensible; have sense; be open to reason; 〔価値を知る〕 be appreciative 《of…》.

・クラシックを少しはわかると思っています.　I think I have some appreciation of classical music.
・この絵のよさがわからない.　I don't appreciate what's good about this picture.

わけ２【訳】 [ローマ字](wake)
1 〔事情・理由〕 (a) reason; (a) cause; circumstances. [⇒わけあり]
►どんな訳があるか知らないが…　for some (unknown) reason; somehow (or other)
・なぜささいなことにあんなに大騒ぎしているのか訳がわからない.　I don't see why she's making all that fuss about a trifling matter.
・何か深い訳があるのだろう.　There must be some deep reason ┏for [behind] it.
・与野党の急接近には何か訳があるはずだ.　There must be something to this sudden intimacy between the government and opposition parties.
・どんな訳があって彼らは示談にしようとしたのだろう.　I wonder what prompted them to settle the case out of court.
・何が何だか訳がわからない.　I don't know what's what. ｜ I can't make out what it's all about.
・うちの娘がどうしてダイエットをしてやせたがっているのか訳がわからない.　I can't see why my daughter is dieting in order to lose weight.
・訳がわからないうちにすべては終わっていた.　Everything was over before I knew what it was all about.
►どういう訳で会社をやめたのですか.　Why [For what reason] did you leave your company?
►なぜ遅れたか, 訳を聞こうか.　Tell me how come you were late.
・彼女は集まりに欠席する訳を話してくれなかった.　She gave me no reason for not attending the meeting.
►訳あって彼は独身を通している.　He has his reasons for staying ┏single [unmarried].
・訳もなく涙が出た.　I cried for no ┏reason [cause].
・獣医のあなたが犬嫌いとはどういう訳ですか.　How [Why] is it that you, a vet, don't like dogs?
・あなたの申し出を断ったのはどういう訳だろう.　How come she didn't accept your offer?
・どういう訳か, 今はそのことについて話したがらない.　Somehow (or other) she doesn't seem to feel like talking about it right now.
・どうしてあんなにつましくしているのだろうか. 生活に困っている訳ではないのに.　Why is she so careful with her money, I wonder? It isn't as if she is badly off.
・そういう訳だったのか.　Now I see what it was all about. ｜ Ah, so that's why!
2 〔内容の示すこと・意味〕 (a) meaning.
►早口だったので訳がわからなかった.　She talked so fast that I couldn't follow her.
►訳のわからないことをわめき散らす　spout [talk] gibberish
・訳のわからないまま書類にサインしてしまった.　I signed the document without considering the consequences.
・訳のわからない食べ物が出た.　Something was put on the table that I didn't recognize.
・最近は訳のわからない事件が多い.　There are too many baffling incidents these days.
►訳もわからずに反対を唱える　object [voice an objection] without knowing the purport of 《the proposal》.
3 〔道理〕 reason.
►この秘密を彼が知っている訳がない.　He can't possibly know this secret.
・物を盗んでよい訳がない.　It's absolutely wrong to steal things.
・彼女が親友のあなたを裏切る訳がない.　It's impossible to think that she'll [There is no reason to believe that she'll] betray you, her closest friend.
・どう考えてもあの二人が幸福な夫婦になれない訳がない.　I see no reason why they should not make a happy couple.
►訳のわからないことを言う　talk ┏nonsense [rubbish]
・訳のわかった人　a sensible person; a person with (good) sense
・あんな訳のわからない人物とはつきあわないほうがよい.　It would be better not to keep company with an unreasonable person like him.
4 〔当然のこと〕
►電車が動いていない? 彼が現れない訳だ.　Train service has stopped? So it's natural that he hasn't shown up.
・そういう事情なら彼女が怒る訳だ.　If that's the case, she has ┏every [good] reason to be angry.
・寒い訳だ, 地面が霜で真っ白だ.　No wonder it's cold. The ground is covered with frost.
5 〔なりゆきの次第や結果〕
►彼女の小説を読んだ訳ではないが, 有望な作家らしい.　I haven't read her novel, but she seems to be a promising writer.
・今になって仕事を投げ出す訳にはいかない.　I can't ┏give [ᐦthrow] up my job at this point.
・犯人が逮捕されたからといってこの事件が終結したという訳ではない.　The arrest of the culprit doesn't automatically mean that ┏this case is closed [this incident is over and done with].
・彼女のおかしい冗談に笑わない訳にはいかなかった.　She told such a funny joke that we couldn't help ┏laughing [but laugh].
6 〔意味合い〕
►つまり, あしたも忙しいという訳だね.　So, you're busy tomorrow too?
・いえ, そういう訳ではないんです.　No, that isn't the case.
・パーティーへの招待を断った. 行きたくなかった訳ではないが.　I declined her invitation to the party. Not that I didn't feel like going.
・自慢する訳ではないが, いつもクラスのトップだった.　Though I say it myself [I don't want to brag], but I was always at the top of the class.
7 〔手間〕 trouble; difficulty. [⇒わけない]
►あの人ならこのテレビを 2 階まで運ぶのも訳のないことだろう.　It would be no trouble at all for him to carry this TV upstairs.
►訳もなくやってのける　do 《it》 ┏easily [with ease].
►これを使えばカーペットの染みを取るのは訳はないだろう.　With this, removing the stain from the carpet would be a cinch.
8 〔男女の関係〕 a relationship. [⇒わけあり]
►彼女はあの男性と訳があったらしい.　She seems to have been romantically involved with him.

よい３【良い】 [ローマ字](yoi)
1 〔悪・誤・劣・醜・凶に対して善・正・優・美・吉〕 (上等の) good; (優秀な) excellent; (良好な) satisfactory; (見事な) fine; (正しい) right; (上手な) able; (美しい) attractive; (社会的に上位の) high; (裕福な) well off; (値が高い) expensive; (親しい) close; (吉の) auspicious;(幸運な) lucky. [⇒いい２, よからぬ, よき, よかれ]
►非常によい　excellent; superb; outstanding

・せいぜいよくて　at best; at the very best.
►数学の成績がよかった.　My score in mathematics was good.
・この会社の来年度の業績見通しはかなりよい.　This company's business prospects for the next fiscal year are quite good.
・この旅行はよい思い出になるだろう.　This trip will be something to remember.
・あれはたいそうよい子だ.　He's a great ┏child [《口》 kid]. ｜ That child is as good as gold.
・彼女は家柄[育ち]がよい.　She ┏comes from a good family [had a good upbringing].
・彼は昔はよい暮らしをしていたのだ.　He used to ┏have a good life [live well] in the old days.
・結婚式は暦を調べてよい日を選ぼう.　Let's check the calendar and choose ┏a lucky [an auspicious] day for the wedding ceremony.
・彼女はよい星の下に生まれたに違いない.　She must have been born under a lucky star.
・あの会社とはこれからもよい関係を保っていきたい.　We want to maintain ┏good relations [a positive relationship] with that company going forward.
・時々昔はよかったなあと思う.　Sometimes I think that things were better in the old days.
・モノさえよければ高くても売れる.　We can get a high price for them as long as the quality is ┏OK [good].
・店員がいないのを見てふとよくない考えがよぎった.　A bad idea [An evil temptation] suddenly crossed my mind when I noticed that there were no clerks around.
2 〔適当〕 (適当な) suitable; (効果的な) effective; (好適な) fitting; (快適な) comfortable; (好都合な) convenient; (有益な) advantageous; (望ましい) desirable; (好ましい) pleasing. [⇒いい２ 2]
►この会社は勤務条件がよい.　Working conditions are good at this company.
・あまりよい返事をもらえなかった.　We didn't get a very positive answer.
・よい結果を待っています.　We're expecting a favorable outcome.
・よいおしめりだ.　This is a welcome rain!
・明日なら都合がよい.　Tomorrow would be convenient.
・それはよい考えだ.　That's a ┏good [great, ᐦcapital] idea.
・よい練習環境に恵まれて彼の記録はぐんと伸びた.　He was fortunate to have a good environment for practicing, so he was able to extend his record significantly.
・準備はよいか, では出発!　Is everything ready? Then let's go!
・それはよくない傾向だ.　That's not a good trend. ｜ That's not looking good.
・「このごろ血圧が高くてね」 「それはよくないね」　"My blood pressure has been high lately."―"That's too bad."
・昨日の弁当がよくなかったかな, 腹が痛い.　Something must have been ┏wrong [《口》funny] with that box lunch yesterday. My stomach hurts.
3 〔(「…でよい」 「よかったら」などの形で) 許容・満足〕 [⇒いい２ 3, よし５, よろしい]
►あなたがよいと思う金額を払ってください.　Pay what you think is right.
・どうぞよい方をお取りください.　Please take whichever you like.
・試しに使ってみて, よかったら買おうと思う.　I'll try it out and buy it if I like it.
・よかったらお茶でもいかが.　If you feel like it we might have a cup of tea.
・よかったらどうぞお持ち帰りください.　Please feel free to take one.
・「陛下, もう一度お考え直しを」 「もうよい, 下がれ」　"Your Majesty, please reconsider."―"That's enough. Go away."
・明日でもよくって? 私今日は行けないの.　How would tomorrow be? I can't go today.
4 〔(「…してよい」などの形で) 承認・許可〕 [⇒いい２ 4, よし５]
►費用はいくらかさんでもよい.　Never mind the expense!
・いきなり明日から来なくてよいと言われてびっくりした.　I was shocked to be told out of the blue that they didn't want me to work there anymore after today.
・テロとの戦いは新しい形の世界戦争と言ってもよかろう.　One could say that the war on terror is a new kind of world war.
5 〔(「…だとよい・すればよい・した方がよい」などの形で) 願望・勧誘〕 [⇒いい２ 6]
►…だとよいのだが…　I ┏wish [hope]….
►〔うわさなどを聞いて〕 本当でなければよいが.　I hope it's not true.
・あなたも検診を受けてみたらよいと思う.　I think you should get a check-up, too.
6 〔(「…してよかった」の形で) 安心・歓喜〕
►財布が見つかってよかった.　I'm pleased that someone found my wallet.
・予習しておいてよかった.　It's a good thing I went over what we studied.
・よかったね!　〔祝意〕 That's great! ｜ I'm really happy for you!
・よかったね, 本当に, 合格おめでとう!　That's really great. Congratulations on passing!
7 〔(「…よりよい・…の方がよい」などの形で) 比較的まし〕 [⇒いい２ 8]
►よりよい, もっとよい　better; superior 《to…》
・ずっとよい　much [far] better.
►若い時は独身の方がよいと思うだろう.　Young people seem to think that they're better off single.
8 〔念押し〕 ⇒いい２ 10, いいか.
►二度は言わないぞ. よいな!　I'm not going to say this again, so listen up!
9 〔(動詞について) …しやすい〕 easy to do. [⇒いい２ 11]
►肉は食べよい大きさに切ってくれ.　Cut the meat into ┏easy-to-eat [bite-size(d)] pieces.
・この道は広くて歩きよい.　This road is wide and good for walking.
